results.description:
אתם מוזמנים לשמוע הרצאה מרתקת על הטיפול בפצועים סורים בבתי חולים בישראל מפי דר׳ סלמן זרקה מבית החולים זיו.

Syrians are now accessing medical help at Ziv Medical Center, just over the border in Israel — a place they’ve long considered enemy territory. More than 500 Syrians have been treated at Ziv, and 70% – 80% percent are combatants. Although this health care initiative is considered humanitarian work, the politics are unavoidable. When Syrian patients check out of Ziv, Hebrew lettering is sanded off their prosthetic limbs and their pills are removed from Hebrew blister packs.

What are the ethics of filling an Israeli hospital’s limited beds with Syrians? Is the Israeli government silently hoping for intelligence from these patients in return for their care? How do the Israeli doctors and nurses feel about caring for people they have been taught to fear, and do the Syrian patients trust the medical workers? Join us to hear Dr. Salman Zarka, doctor at Ziv Medical Center and former Israeli Defense Forces colonel, discuss the answers to these complex questions and many more at this Ford Hall Forum/WorldBoston event.

מידע נוסף ב:
http://www.fordhallforum.org/programs/israel-syria
הרשמה חינם
results.name: Extending a Hand: The Humanitarian Treatment of Syrian Casualties in Israel

results.description:
Anyone who loves ASL is welcome to come and be part of the fun! We want to warmly extend an invitation to Deaf people or others fluent/skilled in the language (CODAs for example) to join our group.

This is an easy-going, casual, ASL get-together to meet people who enjoy American Sign Language, who want to brush up on their signing skills, and want to learn more ASL by using it as often as possible.

We strive to have a good time and communicate without using voices. If we need to, we draw or write what we don't know how to sign, and if lots of folks show up, we split up into small groups and mix and mingle, so we can actually see one another clearly, face-to-face and get a good conversation going.

results.description:
For our next Meetup we will be reading Men Explain Things to Me by Rebecca Solnit and Fun Home: A Family Tragicomic by Alison Bechdel. TWO (short) books. 

With the Holiday Season upon us, we thought it would be best to read something light and "fun". 

Men Explain Things to Me is a series of honest, funny essays about the authors interactions with "mansplain-y" men. Solnit tackles big themes of gender, power dynamics and challenges the status quo of women's roles in the world. 

Fun Home: A Family Tragicomic has earned it's place within the feminist and queer literary canons. Fun Home is a gorgeous graphic novel that depicts the author's emotionally fraught childhood and coming-of-age in the shadow of her closeted gay father. Namesake of the Bechdel Test, Alison Bechdel is insightful, wry and engaging. LOVE HER. 

Looking forward to seeing everyone on December 9th!

-Laura
results.name: Men Explain Things to Me by Rebecca Solnit AND Fun Home by Alison Bechdel

Market Talk by Basil Chapman

Basil is one of our most popular speakers.  He will give us his analysis on the current market using his Chapman Wave technical analysis.  He will also analyze some stocks of your choosing.  

As Editor of The Chapman Marketline and Trendswatch since 1984, Basil Chapman’s service has been used by Fidelity’s Technical Department, hedge funds, banks, money managers, and individual clients. Often quoted in Barron’s MarketWatch section, as well as winning TheStreet.com’s“timing“ competition, where his analysis has often been referenced, Basil has a history of significant market-trend calls.

While hand drawing charts from the late 1970s into the 1980s, he noticed that prices under most circumstances virtually always had a certain number of legs to the upside before declining sharply. Later he found that computer software, which included the standard market technical indicators, enhanced the degree of accuracy in calling price turns. As well as market trend calls.

Thus was born the ChapmanWave Up/Down Sequence.

Basil has an online radio show every Monday, Wednesday and Friday from 11AM to Noon at TFNN.com.

If you have a friend you talk stocks with, bring them with you! Food or drinks are not allowed in any MIT meeting room. We strongly urge each person to make his or her own decisions about investing their money. Investment ideas and recommendations made during our meetings and in our online dialogs bear no liability by anyone. This is a free and open meeting. No membership is required, but please RSVP.

Note that the address for the Tang Center, MIT’s building E51, is 70 Memorial Drive, but the entrance is at 2 Amherst Street. You can park behind the building, or one block West off Hayward Street.) See map: http://whereis.mit.edu/map-jpg­­­­­­?...

Market psychology is the rubber band that stretches stock prices far below or above their intrinsic value.  Over drinks let's talk about the following:

* Common mistakes investors made when the market dropped significantly in 2008-2009. Our own psychology can bias us from getting the returns we desire.  

* How to be greedy when others are fearful (buying low), and fearful when others are greedy (selling high) without mistakenly purchasing a falling knife or selling a multi-year winner far too soon.

results.description:
Here are just some of the things you can get out of these meetings:

• Access to thousands of dollars of courses, software, and other resources

• Advice on overcoming a business or marketing obstacle you're facing

• Accountability

• Ideas and inspiration

• Meet awesome people who enjoy talking about this stuff as much as you do

Or, you can be a fly on the wall.  No pressure at all.  Feel free to drop in to just listen and see what internet marketing really looks like from people who are actually doing it.

We try to keep the meetings to about 60 - 90 minutes.  Here's the way it works:

• 7:00pm Join the meeting here:  https://hangouts.google.com/call/dq4qhhdefftaq3fmqwij2ipe2ea.  It tends to work best with Chrome (rather than Internet Explorer or FireFox).

• Intros, and goal checking:

• New Members:  What are you working on?  And what is it you hope to get out of attending these meetings?

• Existing Members:  How'd your week go?  Did you accomplish your goals?  What are your goals for next week.

• Check-Up on last week's Couch of Insight participate:  What results did he/she get from the session?

• The Couch of Insight:  One member goes into depth on what they've been working on, telling us where they need assistance, what resources have helped them to be successful, and what strategies have been valuable.

• (Meeting Ends around 8pm officially, but usually runs late with people wanting to help the person on The Couch.)

• Chat and Offer Assistance: The Hangout will remain open until everyone leaves.  You can stay as long as you want to meet new members and give the person on The Couch any advice or feedback you may have.

Feedback

What's ONE thing that would have made this meeting better? Either let me know during the session, or you can keep it anonymous by filling out the a Survey Monkey (I'll provide the link in the session).

<a href="https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/KFNMRFX"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: Google Hangouts.  Join by clicking the link in the description.  Give it a shot before the meeting to make sure you can join without any problems.  Let me know if you're having trouble.
results.name: Weekly Remote Mastermind Session

Welcome to the weekly BKBS Wednesday meet up. Please join us at 7:00 PM by the 3rd table station in the middle of the top roping / lead area. If you are still by the bouldering wall, keep on walking.

We usually meet there for about 10 mins, and then team up in groups of 2 or 3 for top-rope climbing.

If you know that you'll be late, let us know in the comments section, and maybe tell us what you'll be wearing, so we can look out for you. 

BKBS (http://www.bkbsomerville.com/Classes/. If you have a working knowledge of how to belay, you will need to be belay certified before climbing on the ropes. Please flag down a BKBS employee and let them know you need to take a belay test. To pass such a test you will need to display how to tie a double figure eight knot with a fisherman's backup, safely belay a climber up a wall, catch them on a fall, and lower them to the ground safely.

What equipment do I need?  You will need at the bare minimum a harness and climbing shoes. Rentals are available. Grigri devices are provided at every station.

What if I can come, but at a different time?  Just let everyone know you want to climb at a different time and use the community to find a partner for those dates / times.

These are the climbing rates:

ADMISSION (Full day use, you can leave and come back!): 

Day Pass - $25 (Students $20) 
10 Pack - $225 (Students $180)

(Membership Pricing also available)

RENTALS: 

Shoes - $5 
Harness - $5 
Chalk Bag - $2 
Full Gear Kit - $11

results.description:
The Boston Austrian Economics Group will meet to discuss the economic impacts of "Not In My Backyard" (NIMBY) zoning laws.

Please note that the readings are not required to attend our meeting, but are recommended. As always, anyone interested in economics is welcome.

Tony C's Sports Bar and Grill has plenty of parking and is accessible via the Orange Line "Assembly" stop. 

READINGS:

"Why Is the Rent Too Damn High? Because We Ignore the Real Problem" by Randal O'Toole, Cato Institute
http://www.cato.org/blog/why-rent-too-damn-high-because-we-ignore-real-problem

"Piketty’s Accidental Argument Against Zoning" by Andrew Criscione
https://andrewc.liberty.me/pikettys-accidental-argument-against-zoning/

STUDY QUESTIONS:

1.) What is rent, and how is it distinguished from profit? What is political rent?

2.) What do cartels do to increase rent? What are the economic consequences of this?

3.) The two main lobbying forces for Alcohol Prohibition were the Baptists and the bootleggers. What is the equivalent of these two groups when it comes to modern zoning laws?

4.) What is true of US cities with stricter zoning regimes? Where do these cities tend to be located?

5.) What happens to prices over time in a cartel? What happens to prices over time in a competitive market?

6.) Have there been historical instances of land cartels? BONUS: How does this factor into the Manchester Liberal movement?

7.) When the state fixes prices high by cartelizing an industry, does this cause shortages like price fixing otherwise would?

8.) When the state fixes prices, black markets typically emerge. What is the black market for housing?

9.) How can zoning laws be a more effective migraiton barrier than border walls and deportations?

10.) How could public schools, when combined with zoning laws, resemble apartheid? BONUS: How was the welfare state used to justify apartheid in South Africa?
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in the back room.
results.name: The Economics of "Not In My Backyard!"

results.description:
PLEASE NOTE: In anticipation of the Glass-Chewing Leader of the Cartel's imminent absence due to Family Growth, hosting duties for the regular Wednesday Night Gaming is being handled by a rotating cast of regulars.

Wednesday Night Gaming is our more-or-less weekly free-for-all of strategy gaming goodness downstairs at the Porter Square Panera. There's rarely a set agenda for these events but you are welcome and encouraged to hash out a plan beforehand in comments if you've got something you're dying to play. Nonetheless, you are not required to bring a game to play -- our only requirement is that you bring an open mind!

The event officially begins at 7 PM but people often trickle in early, so you're welcome to sit down to a filler game to get warmed up, or arrange to meet a little early if you've got a group looking to tackle an extra-meaty game.

Please be aware that Panera has been quite gracious about hosting us with minimal fuss -- in order to keep things this way, please respect the hardworking people who work there and, especially, their desire to get out after a long shift.

We'll see you at the gaming table!
results.name: Wednesday Gaming In Porter Square

The $1 sign up is to make sure RSVP's are accurate-- I'll be throwing this amount into the table's tip. :)

results.description:
Once each month, Amazing Things Arts Center hosts a night of Open Mic Cabaret.  If you want to belt out a song or two, or just come to watch and support all levels of performers, please join us at this very friendly and fun evening.

Admission is $10 for 3 hours of entertainment ($9 for BACA and ATAC members).  The show begins at 7pm, and if you want to sing, sign-ups begin anytime after 6:30pm (the earlier you arrive, the more of a chance you can sing two songs!).  Also, in order to sing, you will need to bring sheet music so the pianist can accompany you.  Snacks and drinks are available for purchase.

results.description:
Join me at a restaurant that I've never been to and navigate if it is one we want to return to. It looks as if it has plenty of good reviews. And if you never try new things, you never discover what you're missing. (PS Hot and flavorful Thai soups are one of the best things ever if you're feeling the blues of winter settle around you- the days get darker and shorter) Let's try Thai: 

http://phuketthaiwakefield.com

I typically bring my yellow Bananagrams game as a table marker for my Meetup groups. Often we play a game or three after we eat if time permits or the restaurant atmosphere allows. 

Also please post a photo of yourself in your profile page. If you do not post a photo of yourself I will remove you from the RSVP list. 

As an event organizer I also have low tolerance for no shows. Be aware that if you do not show up and do not cancel your RSVP I will document your NO SHOW status to be alerted for future MeetUP leaders who can evict you from the group (including myself). Also I will not probably not allow you to join me for future events.
results.how_to_find_us: look for the yellow banana on the table /RSVP under my name
results.name: Ethnic Eats/ Let's try Thai in Wakefield

Coverall -

results.description: On the second Wednesday of every month at 7:30pm, the Foxboro Jaycees membership meets to discuss chapter business. We hear reports from the President, area vice presidents, treasurer, donations director, dues director, and secretary. We eat, we socialize, we get business done. Please join us!

results.description:
This Meetup is intended for Intermediate/ Intermediate + level players with firm understanding of game strategy. Should be able to have a good grasp of skills (passing, setting, hitting) and be able to move around to cover areas of the court. Play should consistently be bump-set-spike. If you'd like to play, please do the following: Click RSVP or send an email to Alan using the following URL:

http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/message/?recipientId=186541038

Note that sending an email does not guarantee a spot to play; spots are only guaranteed if you receive a positive confirmation email. We will do our best to make sure the event is co-ed, have setters, and incorporate a couple new members who want to join as well. The location for this volleyball meetup is at the JCC of the North Shore, 4 Community Road, Marblehead, MA[masked] |

This event is free if you are a member of JCC. If not, it's a one-time $8 membership fee that is valid for a day. As always, please remember: - Respect the RSVP system (Don't show up expecting to play without a confirmed RSVP) - If it looks like you won't be able to make it or will run late please cancel your RSVP in time for someone else to join. Event day/last minute cancellations and no shows will jeopardize your participation in future events.
results.name: Marblehead Intermediate Indoor Volleyball 7:30-9:30 PM

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and shared energy. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in Boston?

At TurnON, we play three communication games, and you can participate at whatever level feels good to you. Imagine meeting new people in an environment where they feel comfortable to be themselves; a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation. That's what we have created.

TurnON events give you the opportunity to look deeper into yourself, through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses. What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to be authentic. It's like a giant exhale when the rest of the world is asking you to hold it in. In just an hour, you may even forget that you are in Boston.

TurnON Boston is an organization that teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. At the end of the evening, we will give you a brief description of the practice of Orgasmic Meditation and information on where to learn more. The games we play at TurnON events are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without actually doing the practice (or touching anyone, or removing any clothing!).

$10, payable at the door.

Limited non-resident parking is available alongside our building on Dudley Street, or plentiful metered spaces on Mass Ave are only one block away (and free after 6pm). We are a 10-minute walk from the Red Line at Davis Square.

Curious about what Orgasmic Meditation is about? More info here:
http://tedxtalks.ted.com/video/TEDxSF-Nicole-Daedone-Orgasm-Th

results.description:
Limelight Comedy Club is back Wednesday, December 9 with a very special headliner Sean Leary & feature act, Eric Hahn Sean performs nightly in Los Angeles whether it’s at a comedy club, bar, or theater. Sean won the 2013 Ice House Comedy Club Talent Showcase in Pasadena, CA and soon after became a paid regular. In 2014, Sean was selected to perform in the 1st ever San Diego Comedy Festival in San Diego, CA. In February 2014, Sean was the highest rated and viewed comedian on LAFFEST.com and won their first ever Los Angeles showcase at the Hollywood Improv. In March of 2014, Sean taped a set for Comedy Time TV on Hulu.com. In April and May of 2014, Sean embarked on the successful Great Plains Party Tour where he traveled the Midwest performing 11 sold out shows! In June of 2014, Sean was a featured comedian on Ora TV’s recently cancelled online show, Headline Punchline. Sean also hosts and produces a bi-weekly show named #FreeParking at the Garage in Culver City, CA. Sean is currently starring in, producing, and writing for an online series titled 'Brick & Sizzle' - a buddy cop comedy that follows two LAPD police officers who moonlight as fashion models. This past spring, Sean competed on America's Got Talent! In September 2015, Sean was named an 'UP RISER' fresh face comedian to watch by Stand Up Magazine. Eric Hahn is a stand-up comic and writer based out of Los Angeles. In 2009 Eric was fired from his long standing manager job at a restaurant chain (whose initials are CPK) when he first started performing comedy for joking about said company (aforementioned CPK) on stage. The silver lining to being canned (his first time ever being fired for anything) was a headlong dive into stand up comedy, acting and writing. Eric hates pizzas, pastas, salads and attorneys who start restaurants. Eric is the founder and creator of 'LA’s Best’ a series of fun, tightly run comedy shows currently enjoying a run the first Wednesday of every month at WitZend in Venice, CA.

Also on this show will be:
Ray Bryant
Matt Miller
Arty P
Luke Touma
Hosted by Alex Gettlin

Tickets: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/limelight-comedy-club-tickets-19117834959?aff=eac2

Limelight Comedy Club is Boston's newest stand-up comedy venue, featuring the hottest up and coming comics working today. Located in the heart of Boston's theater district, Limelight Comedy Club is just steps away from the iconic Wilbur Theater, and hosts weekly shows every Wednesday night featuring top talent. $5. 18+.
results.name: Limelight Comedy Club Presents Sean Leary from America's Got Talent & MTV. $5.

results.description:
Join 50 to 80 or 100 dancers any Wednesday at Dance Freedom!!

We are the original barefoot weekly dance, continuously running for 44 years, that has spawned hundreds if not thousands of other dances around the world.

In a drug, alcohol, and shoe-free environment, we've been making friends and sharing safe and juicy dances for decades. Come join the fun!! Discover the joy of dancing in a totally non-judgmental atmosphere, where anything safe and respectful goes... dance by yourself, in a group, with a same or opposite sex partner, or even just chat and enjoy watching.

First time visitors are welcomed heartily, and get in for half price! Otherwise, you decide what to pay in a range from $10 to $20, or less later in the evening as the event nears its end (information on late admission discounts is at the door). Our friendly dancers range from utterly new at it to very skilled dancers in funk, rock, salsa, modern, jazz, hip-hop, African & Latin and swing, tango, contact improvisation, and our own unique spontaneous creations! Dance with or alongside amazing dancers from local dance troupes as well as with ordinary good-hearted rug cutters. At work they may be doctors, lawyers, programmers, massage therapists, expressive therapists, artists, students, dog walkers, scientists, or anything else, but at heart they all love to dance.

The music runs the gamut: funk, world music, soul & r&b, house, trance, hip-hop, salsa, yoga music, jazz or swing, reggae, disco, you name it! Each DJ from our rotating list has a unique style, but we try to include something for everyone in every set. We keep a good balance in the music: familiar with unusual, timeless with current, melodic with drum-based, and positive lyrics with instrumentals--in all kinds of rhythms & styles! In any given evening, the world music parts of our dance are likely to include at least 3 or so of the following... African, Latin, Indian, Middle Eastern, Caribbean, zydeco, gypsy and much more. You'll hear everything from basic party music to very danceable songs with socially conscious lyrics, but you won't be hearing anything sexist, racist, violent, hating or otherwise divisive.

Start with a soothing stretch and warm up at 7:30, connect with the group and start to boogie at 7:50 with our first DJ of the evening, take a brief break at 8:50 for community announcements and a short unique performance or workshop (or chatting & stretching in a way that doesn't interfere), then cut the rug again by 9:15 at the latest with the evening's second DJ, till 10:30--plenty of time for a great workout and some feel-good inspiration and respiration and perspiration!

At the beginning of each half of the evening's music, everyone who wants to gathers around a centerpiece to hold hands, and dance in a winding chain together to a song with uplifting, connective (or at least beautiful and hypnotic) slow to medium tempo rhythms. (This dance was created from out of a drumming circle on the Cambridge Common in the sixties, after all, and some of that great political and community spirit still lives on here.) Then, it's all dance music, generally building in tempo to a crescendo, slowing down again for some more melodic and slow dance songs for a few minutes, then gradually building to a second crescendo. The second half of the evening's dance follows roughly the same pattern with a different DJ and style, and ends with another circle dance for those who enjoy it.

Dancers are always welcome to help with set-up or take-down, and get in free for doing so! It's a great chance to get to know the community better and be serviceful, as well as to save money and help us to be around for another 42 years... Welcome! For more information, E-mail: [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: Opposite the Cambridge Common, see the Sheraton Hotel w/the big red letters COMMANDER on top.  Enter the stone church just left of hotel, @ entrance closest to hotel.  Follow the hall straight, left and right to the desk to sign in.
results.name: Dance Freedom Dj's Chad and Nina rocking the house

results.description:
RoLa Languages Institute is planning to have a great time with all those who have an interest in speaking English. There will be many native English speakers so you can practice your English, learn from fellow students and teachers as well as <a>make friends</a>!

For whom?

Everyone who has any interest in English, from beginner students to native speakers.


When?

Wednesday, December 9th from 7:30 pm - 10:00 pm


Where?

Pho House, 1790 Massachusetts Avenue (above RoLa's Porter Square office in Cambridge)


What will we do?

We will speak English and have some drinks and food!


Come and join our party! We don't care about who you are, where you're from or how you look! Just come and practice your English! This is a really great chance to improve your English skills! 

It's a free, public event but food and drink purchases are a courteous gesture to the restaurant that hosts us, not to mention delicious! 

If you need more information, please contact us!

Website: www.rolalang.com

Email: [masked]

Telephone: (617) 297 - 7789

We hope to see you on Wednesday, December 9th!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the RoLa Languages sign!

results.description:
Ellen Jaffe JonesThe Veg Coach

Creative Cook / Author / Consultant
From our test kitchen to your home kitchen

OK, show of hands.  How many of you eat quinoa as a side dish?
Most cooks use the protein-rich grain as a substitute for rice.
But, I've got a treat for you today.  It's a recipe for Quinoa crisp chocolate balls!
What a way to reward yourself for following a healthy lifestyle.

Find it below.

Consider this too as a tasty approach to getting people interested in coming to one of my FREE cooking classes. This week, Wednesday at 9pm EST, I'll be doing a free class prepping and serving 2 recipes from my book "Eat Vegan on $4 a Day." Bring any questions to our Google Hangout: 

https://plus.google.com/events/c0oegddjuh07utbrq1mv6vm1rfg

Happy cooking,

Ellen Jaffe Jones
The Veg Coach
http://www.vegcoach.com

Buy my books:

Paleo Vegan

Eat Vegan on $4 a Day

Kitchen Divided - Vegan Recipes for Semi-Vegan Households

This is a Quinoa crisp chocolate bar you might find at your local health food store.  
But, my recipe lets you create your own Quinoa chocolate treat.  

It'll satisfy your chocolate cravings and it's so easy to make.  

The recipe is below.

You're Going to Love This!  

Quinoa Crisp Chocolate Treats
by Ellen Jaffe Jones

INGREDIENTS 

1 cup vegan chocolate chips
1/2 cup puffed quinoa
4 teaspoons coconut oil
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional)

PREPARATION INSTRUCTIONS

1 cup vegan chocolate chips
1/2 cup puffed quinoa
4 teaspoons coconut oil
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional)

Melt chocolate chips in a double-boiler, or place in a microwave-safe bowl and heat for about 60 seconds until the chips develop a slight sheen.  
Place all ingredients in a medium pot (or add to the double-boiler) and over medium heat, and stir constantly for about 5 minutes taking care not to burn the chocolate. 
Form small balls and place on a non-stick cookie sheet.  
Refrigerate for at least 60 minutes before serving.  
For those wanting to reduce fat intake, this can be made without the coconut oil, but make sure the chocolate chips are completely melted.

Meditation practice develops concentration, which allows us to calm and steady the mind and give us clear access to our natural wisdom. This practice is 30 minutes of guided Vipassana meditation followed by a brief discussion.

The focus is to be present in the moment, allowing thoughts and emotions to surface. We become an internal observer of these, fostering healthy non-attachment and cultivating a deeper connection with one's inner self.

Newcomers to meditation and long-time practitioners are welcome to attend.

results.description:
If you're thinking "I can't sit still / quiet my mind" you're not alone, and it's not exactly true. You can, with practice, develop these innate skills of self mastery. 

Max Meditation can help. Come experience it for yourself!


Using guided relaxation, passive and active meditation & visualization techniques.  This proven system is helpful for both the novice looking to experience the benefits of meditation but are in need of assistance in achieving the desired outcome, as well as the adept wanting to go deeper into their meditation practice. 

Meet the teacher: 

Hi, I'm Shawna :D As a holistic health Practitioner of 15 years, I know first hand how the mind/body connection plays a significant role in ones health, relationships & personal satisfaction in life. I've found meditation & guided imagery as an incredibly valuable tool to assist students / clients in achieving lasting results. 

Some of the Many Benefits of Meditation:

Reduction of Stress, Tension & Pain (both physical and emotional)Clarity, Spontaneity & CreativityPeace of Mind & Well BeingEnhanced Energy Strength & VitalitySelf DiscoverySense of PurposeConnection to Inner GuidanceAlternative to Medication for ADHD and Other ConditionsImproves Focus & ConcentrationBuilds Self ConfidenceIncreases Serotonin (which aids in relief of depression, headaches & insomnia)

results.description:
Register Now!

Please note: this event requires additional registration. Please click the above now link to properly register for this event in addition to RSVPing. In addition, please do not confuse 1 Memorial Drive (wrong location) with 255 Main St (right location) in Cambridge - these are both event spaces run by Microsoft. If you can not see the Kendall/MIT red line stop entrance a few steps away from the entrance, you are most likely in the wrong location. You will come to an elevator that will allow you to go to the 2nd floor, and then you take a separate elevator to the 4th floor.

The aggregation of data can truly revolutionize the future of healthcare. Ranging from more traditional data sources, such as EMRs and payment/claims systems, to more cutting-edge sources, such as clinical trials and DNA sequencing, the breadth and depth of data available today is unparalleled. By effectively leveraging this data, every player in the healthcare ecoysystem can make more informed decisions. This panel will explore the various sources and uses of healthcare data as well as how your organization can best use this data to improve outcomes and performance in the ever-changing healthcare environment. The panel will also talk about areas for future innovation and entrepreneurship.

Join us for healthy refreshments, including sandwiches, sushi, and nonalcoholic drinks.

Price: $25 until December 9th at 8:00 pm; $35 after then.

Free for full time college students through Stay in MA.

In the Christmas spirit, this reflects that we have reduced our pricing by $5 for this event!

Free for full time college students through Stay in MA.

Place: Microsoft Corporate Center 

Agenda: 
Networking - 6:00 pm to 6:40 pm  
Program: 6:40 pm to 8:00 pm 
Networking: 8:00 pm to 8:45 pm

Speakers

</a><a href="http://www.healthinno.com/events.php">Robbie Gleenglass, Managing Director, Waterline Ventures

In 2014, Robbie founded Waterline Ventures, an investment firm focused on Healthcare technology and technology enabled services. Robbie also serves as the Director of Business Development at Shields Pharmacy Services.

Prior to founding Waterline, Robbie was an investor at Highland Capital Partners working with early and late-stage healthcare companies. Prior to joining Highland, Robbie was an Associate in the Healthcare Group at Oppenheimer where he focused on M&A, public- and private-equity transactions for healthcare services and IT, biotechnology and specialty pharmaceuticals.

Robbie is a founding member of the Board for Breakthrough Boston, a non-profit that partners with local schools to provide programs for motivated, at-risk youth. Robbie is also a mentor at Blueprint Health in NYC, a healthcare accelerator for early stage healthcare IT companies. Mr. Greenglass earned his B.A. from Brown University where he currently serves on the Brown Alumni Association Board of Governors and acts as co-chairman of the Social Networking and New Media committee. Robbie earned his MBA from Harvard Business School.

</a> <a href="http://www.healthinno.com/events.php">Charlie Schick, PHD, Senior Director of Healthcare, Atigeo

Charlie Schick, PhD, is Senior Director of Healthcare at Atigeo. He also advises healthcare start-ups on mobile, marketing, and analytics. Prior to Atigeo, he worked at IBM on the Big Data Industry Leadership sales team as a sales consultant. Before that, he worked at Boston Children’s Hospital, and at Nokia, in Finland. During his career he has designed and launched web and mobile products; provided internet, social media, and content strategy consulting; written numerous articles for online and print publications; published several biomedical research papers in leading journals; and co-authored a book on advanced phone systems. He has a graduate degree in molecular and cellular biology from the University of Massachusetts Amherst.

</a> <a href="http://www.healthinno.com/events.php">Adrian Zai Clinical Director of Population Informatics Massachusetts General Hospital, Partners HealthCare

Adrian Zai, MD, is the clinical director of population informatics at the Massachusetts General Hospital’s Laboratory of Computer Science and a faculty member of Harvard Medical School. Mass General is the #1 ranked hospital in the United States by U.S. News and World Report, Harvard Medical School's largest teaching hospital, and part of the Partners HealthCare system. Dr. Zai has been in healthcare for over 20 years, with the last 12 years focused on population health management. He is the lead designer and innovator of TopCare, an information technology platform designed uniquely for population health management with core components that support team-based care and patient-centered management.

</a> <a href="http://www.healthinno.com/events.php">Ocean Li, Director of Solution Design at Connance

Ocean Li serves as Director of Solution Design at Connance. In that role, Ocean is responsible for developing new products and services to meet the needs of Connance's hospital partners. With over 100,000,000 patient encounters in data assets and upwards of 1,000 hospital partners around the country, Connance is healthcare’s premier source of predictive analytic technology solutions that enable hospitals and clinicians to optimize financial and clinical workflows for sustained performance improvement. Prior to his current role, Ocean led the teams working to build and improve Connance's analytical capabilities. He has also served as a Product Manager at Shareable Ink and an Analyst at Capital One. Ocean holds a BA in economics from Harvard University and an MBA from Boston University. He enjoys photography and sailing, and has competed in both local and national tango events.

Moderator

</a><a href="http://www.healthinno.com/events.php">Jon Puz, Co-President, HBS Healthcare Alumni Association

Jon Puz is an entrepreneurial executive with a background in launching, scaling, and advising healthcare technology companies. Since graduating from Harvard Business School, he has served as a key leader and driven the growth of three successful ventures focusing on improving patient outcomes. His senior-level leadership roles have included strategy, business development, finance, product development, operations, and technology. While pursuing his MBA, Puz co-wrote the business plan for a diagnostics company, which is the only organization to ever win both the HBS Business Plan Contest and the MIT $100K. He also helped launch the organization and served as an advisor. Prior to HBS, he served as a strategy and operations consultant within the healthcare industry. Puz holds a BS in computer science and systems analysis from Miami University (Ohio) and an MBA from Harvard University.

Register Now!

Take The  8 Steps That Will Change Your Life

The Original Steppers of Boston has earned two  Steppin' Instruction Certifications**.                            


Every Thursday

Classes - Practice - Open Dance

Beginners Welcome!!
Men, Women, Singles, Couples

 

Instructional Hours:

 

Beginners Class 6pm -7pm

Everyone Else Class 7pm-8pm


Open Dance & Practice 8pm - Until


 

The Original Steppers of Boston offer Certified Chicago Style Steppin' dance instruction for the new beginner to the seasoned stepper. We also host a supportive environment for steppers to practice and participate in an open dance to hone their dance skills.

We welcome you to stop by to get an idea of what Steppin' Chicago Style is all about. There is a $10 participation fee to get on the dance floor, first visit is FREE. A partner is encouraged, but not required.

Doors open at 6:00pm.

*** Please wear comfortable clothes and smooth bottom shoes (NO SNEAKERS, MARKING SOLES or RUBBER BOTTOMS)!  Gentlemen must remove their hats. Powder is not allowed on the dance floor***

Bring your Steppin' notebook
Courtesy Note:: Please be on time.
Practice outside of class is expected and necessary.

Class attendance may be a prerequisite for the Royce Banks Steppin' Is A Lifestyle Workshops.

**Certified Instruction provided by The Original Steppers of Boston Inc 2006 Team**

Full Bar!!  Free Parking!! Kitchen is Open!!

We ask that you patronize the bar and tip the staff for their services.

He is the lead designer and innovator of TopCare, an information technology platform designed uniquely for population health management with core components that support team-based care and patient-centered management.

Ocean Li, Director of Solution Design at Connance

Ocean Li serves as Director of Solution Design at Connance. In that role, Ocean is responsible for developing new products and services to meet the needs of Connance's hospital partners. With over 100,000,000 patient encounters in data assets and upwards of 1,000 hospital partners around the country, Connance is healthcare’s premier source of predictive analytic technology solutions that enable hospitals and clinicians to optimize financial and clinical workflows for sustained performance improvement. Prior to his current role, Ocean led the teams working to build and improve Connance's analytical capabilities. He has also served as a Product Manager at Shareable Ink and an Analyst at Capital One. Ocean holds a BA in economics from Harvard University and an MBA from Boston University. He enjoys photography and sailing, and has competed in both local and national tango events.

Moderator:

Jon Puz, Co-President, HBS Healthcare Alumni Association

Jon Puz is an entrepreneurial executive with a background in launching, scaling, and advising healthcare technology companies. Since graduating from Harvard Business School, he has served as a key leader and driven the growth of three successful ventures focusing on improving patient outcomes. His senior-level leadership roles have included strategy, business development, finance, product development, operations, and technology. While pursuing his MBA, Puz co-wrote the business plan for a diagnostics company, which is the only organization to ever win both the HBS Business Plan Contest and the MIT $100K. He also helped launch the organization and served as an advisor. Prior to HBS, he served as a strategy and operations consultant within the healthcare industry. Puz holds a BS in computer science and systems analysis from Miami University (Ohio) and an MBA from Harvard University.

results.name: Making the Most of Big Data in Healthcare

results.description:
Thank you to SmarterTravel for sponsoring both the space and food and drink for this event!

Rough schedule:
* 6:00 - 6:40: Food and mingling
* 6:40 - 6:50: Opening remarks & Sponsor pitch
* 6:50 - 6:55: Lightning talk
* 7:00 - 7:30: Feature talk
* 7:40 - 8:10: Feature talk

Lightning Talk: "An update on Flintrock: A faster, better spark-ec2" - Nick Chammas

In this lightning talk Nick will give a quick update on his progress with Flintrock, a hopeful successor to spark-ec2.

Feature Talk: "Cloud Security Monitoring and Spark Analytics" - Andre Mesarovic, ThreatStack

Andre will describe how ThreatStack uses Spark to produce roll-ups from a stream of Linux process events. An auditd-like agent installed on customers’ AWS instances sends a constant stream of kernel events to ThreatStack’s servers. These events are routed to RabbitMQ and a process writes them in batched JSON format to S3. On a fixed interval A Spark job reads the S3 objects, performs a number of aggregations and stores the results in a Postgres database.

Feature Talk: "Feedback Loops Between Ingest Processing & Analytics" - John Hugg, VoltDB

In this talk John Hugg, Founding Engineer of VoltDB, will show how a fast data solution like VoltDB can be combined with a powerful analytic solution like Apache Spark to enable continuous and adaptable processing of events.
  The demonstration will use a click stream analysis example to demonstrate this pattern. VoltDB is used to segment and process individual clicks in real time, based on models generated from periodic batch processing. Spark, and specifically MLlib, is used to build a clustering model based on historical event data. That model is continuously run and continuously loading into VoltDB, where it can be applied to raw data.
  This continuous loop, where models or rules are generated continuously, loaded into the event processing system and applied to live data, is a powerful tool with applications in fraud detection, segmentation and engagement.

This approach will be contrasted with approaches based on Storm and Spark Streaming.

results.description:
Every Thursday evening at 6:30 PM we gather as a group for a nice nighttime "romp" at the Chestnut Hill Reservoir. It's a great way to wind down a busy work day, to catch up with Bulldogs friends, or to meet new people!

The Boston Bulldogs is a co-ed non-profit running club founded to support those battling addiction and in recovery, those who have been affected by addiction and their supporters.

We welcome and encourage runners of all levels – dreamers, beginners, as well as those with running experience, past or present. Our volunteer runners will be there to coach you at your current level, and help you meet your goals. We might even be able to help with running gear if needed. 

We meet twice weekly at the Reservoir (Cleveland Circle/Reservoir Green Line C or D train) -- on Saturday mornings at 10:00 am and Thursday evenings at 6:30 pm. We will first gather in front of the Starbucks in Cleveland Circle, before heading over to the reservoir. See you there!

If you are interested in becoming a member or a volunteer, in making a contribution to the Club, in sponsoring a runner in recovery, or in learning more about the Boston Bulldog educational wellness/running program, contact us at:

• Website - BostonBulldogsRunning.com

• Email - [masked] 

• Phone -[masked]

results.description:
TO ATTEND THIS EVENT YOU MUST REGISTER HERE

Join us for an evening exploring exciting new ideas and technologies in science & publishing! This is the first FuturePub event in the US – coming from London where it has "already become such a staple of the London science tech/publishing scene". :-)

So for everyone new to the event, here's how it works:

Six quick-fire talks cover a range of new and exciting developments in science & publishing tech

These all fit into a one hour slot (from 7-8pm), to keep the evening fast paced and fun!

The rest of the evening is then open for discussions and conversations over drinks – we expect a great mixture of attendees from the research, publishing and start-up communities.

After the event, groups usually continue their discussions at a nearby pub – this time it's even easier as we're running the whole evening – presentations, drinks, nibbles, music and all – at the Davenport Building Atrium in Cambridge! Speakers:
We're excited to have a great line up of speakers! Presentation titles and details are coming soon!

 Michal Duczmal - Head of Annotate.co 

Christopher Erdmann - Head Librarian, Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics, 

John G. Wolbach Library

Alex Hodgson - Director of Marketing/PR , Readcube

John Lees-Miller - Co-founder & CTO, Overleaf

Nick Lindsay - Journals Director, MIT Press Dawn Melley - Director, Editorial Services, IEEE

Location:

The Atrium of The Davenport Building

TO ATTEND THIS EVENT YOU MUST REGISTER HERE, 

A bit about Overleaf: 

Founded in 2012 and with over 300,000 registered users, Overleaf is an academic authorship tool that allows seamless collaboration and effortless manuscript submission, all underpinned by cloud-technology. By providing an intuitive online collaborative writing and publishing platform, Overleaf is making the process of writing, editing and publishing scientific documents quicker and easier. Researchers and academics can now write, collaborate, and publish with a single click, directly from the Overleaf web-app. Publishers and Institutions are partnering with Overleaf to provide customized writing templates, simple reference tool linking, and one-click publishing submission links.

Supported by Digital Science, Overleaf aims to make science and research faster, more open and more transparent by bringing the whole scientific writing process into one place in the cloud - from idea, to writing, to review, to publication.
results.name: Scientific Collaboration - how far have we come and how far do we have to go?

results.description:
Are you a separated or divorced/divorcing parent with tweens/teens? Please join us for this fun and interactive discussion group to form new events for Divorced Parents with Tweens/Teens.

Snacks and refreshments will be provided at this event.

Please join us for a discussion group to create new events for separating/divorced parents who have kids that are in the age range of 11 to 16. Meet parents who are in the same situation and who are looking to create activities that will be for parents along with their tweens/teens.

These events will be designed to create a supportive environment and activities for parents who want to redefine post-divorce family growth, love and joy. At these joint events for parents with their tweens/teens, the parents will have the chance to meet other divorced/divorcing parents and share ideas about how to parent in light of their new situations. The kids will have the opportunity to get to know new peers who are in the same situation, while having joyful moments socializing during group activities such as rock climbing, bowling, ice skating, game nights, camping trips, picnics/BBQ's, etc. (the kids will be able to choose the activity offerings). The kids will see how other children of divorced parents redefine family while growing joyfully.
results.how_to_find_us: Please call or text Deanna at 508-333-3191 with questions or for directions.
results.name: Navigating Divorce Together: Parents and Teens

group.name: HOPE for Single Parents - Boston and Metrowest

results.description:
Creative Thinking for Digital Products: From Users to Technology

We’ve all been there. You got a really good idea, and you’re pretty sure you know how to take it forward. But even the most innovative thinkers or disruptive technologists can get stuck in a mire of stale, predictable concepts.

Here’s how you can get over that hump and generate some new ideas.

Join us for a hands-on workshop, where teams will use our “Idea Engine” to work together on a specific case study to create and refine a product. Our “Idea Engine” is a brainstorming tool designed to give you a new perspective about how products and users relate.


You'll walk away knowing how to:
• Propel the creation and evaluation of your product and platform concepts
• Refine your concepts to uncover new approaches before spending resources on your next idea
• Scale your thinking to target the right audience

Who should participate:
• Innovators and Entrepreneurs
• Product Managers
• UX Managers
• Designers across all disciplines
• Engineers
• Brand Managers

Materials, food,​ and​ drinks​ will be provided​. Seating is limited to 12 attendees on a first come first serve basis. Cost of the workshop is $25.
results.name: A Workshop: Creative Thinking for Digital Products

results.description:
Boston Clojure Group Meetups are held at Akamai

Note the room change!!  We'll be in 90 Broadway, Cambridge MA. 12th Floor.


Please join us for a night of Clojure related discussion and group activities. Pizza and drinks will be provided!


Meet & Greet starts at 6:00. Group activities will begin at 6:30.

Agenda for this meeting:

CIDER - Clojure Interactive Development Environment for Emacs

We'll start out with a demo of the latest version of the Emacs CIDER debugger. With just a few keystrokes you can instrument a function, step though it, inspect variables, inject values, and more!

Those who are interested in following along should install Emacs and CIDER, or get help at the meeting.

We'll also look at other great CIDER features for convenience and productivity. Bring your CIDER tips and tricks to share, and help boost everyone's Clojure productivity.

If there's enough time, we can select Dojo coding challenges to work on.

Hope to see you there!

results.description: Let's meetup for Trivia and BBQ and Cocktails at the Rock 'n' Roll Rib Joint in Medfeild MA. Trivia is on Thursdays and starts at 830. Let's meet around 7:30. This will give us time to hang, get comfortable and eat. The ROCK’N’ROLL RIB JOINT was launched with a simple idea: Combine our two favorite things – barbecue and rock’n’roll music – into a delicious destination for families, BBQ enthusiasts and music lovers. Located in historic Medfield, MA, we hope you’ll enjoy a friendly and eclectic atmosphere, where the rock’n’roll album art and memorabilia celebrates the music of our lives. WE CRAVE BARBEQUE and hope you’ll dig into our menu, which offers headliners like St. Louis Ribs, Pulled Pork and Slow-Smoked Brisket, wild opening acts like BBQ Egg Rolls and our BBQ Sundae, and a band of sandwiches, salads, sides and desserts. All of our barbeque is made possible by our 1000-pound smoker – named Smokey Robinson naturally – which slow cooks the meats using a variety of woods. Wash down all of that goodness with great beers, wines, and our Rock’n’Roll themed drinks. Join the crowd at the Rock’N’Roll Rib Joint, we hope you to see you often!
results.name: Trivia and BBQ and Cocktails at the Rock 'n' Roll Rib Joint in Medfield MA.

results.description:
Come join fellow progressives, democrats, independents, republicans and/or anyone interested in social and political progress. All positive, active and thoughtful folks welcome. We respect and appreciate intelligent and stimulating political and social discourse from all perspectives. 

This gathering will an informal celebration of the Holiday Season with discussions probably varying from table to table.  This is a great casual networking opportunity with learning and camaraderie included. 

Also, let's talk about whats going on with the American electorate. The status of the national primary races. 

Locally let's discuss the now open State Senate seat - who are the declared candidates? Who might run or who might you want to encourage to run? Any candidates of any party are welcome to join us and meet South Shore Progressives and even address the group should time and space allow. 

Of course any other political topics folks want to bring up among themselves is always welcome and encouraged. What about the status and activities relative to the proposed compressor in Weymouth?  Income inequality on the South Shore as well as nationally. 

Feel free to network and organize around any reasonable rational public policy issue at our events. It's all about communication, networking, idea exchanges, learning and activism as you choose. Or just socialize with progressive folks. 

This meet-up is a flexible informal pay for yourself as you go event. 

Look forward to seeing you at our South Shore Progressive Holiday Party - and do bring a friend(s)!
results.how_to_find_us: Like us on Facebook - "South Shore Progressives" - this page keep you informed and up to date.  Feel free to post on it yourself.
results.name: South Shore Progressives Holiday Party

results.description:
We will....

--Explore some of the well worn stereotypes about men and women in relationship and shine a 21st century, brain science light on the subject.

--Explore how this challenge shows up in our lives: He speaks for REPORT - She speaks for RAPPORT.

--Share a take away from the evening to bring in to our relationships that will build connection and celebrate the differences.
  To prepare...

Come with an experience you have of "clicking" when meeting someone new of the same gender - how would you characterize the conversation and connection?

Our facilitator this evening is...

Wendy L. Williams, BSN, M.Ed.

Wendy’s frustration and worry about her own marriage led her to discover her life's work. She’s now a Marriage Mentor & Educator who weaves together her background as a nurse, educator, speaker and personal development coach to help individuals, couples and communities shift from soul-draining to soul-satisfying (re)connections. How do we stay true to ourselves while facing the inevitable challenges of  marriage and relationship? How do we hang in there until we can develop relationships that are nourishing? Wendy is committed to supporting us on the journey to fulfilling relationship. Check her out at <a>www.ConnectAgain.org</a>

Links

results.description:
Cambridge meetup is back! We are going to have this event every other week!


http://www.championscambridge.com/


As usual, please bring your driver's license or passport, if you would like to have alcohol. They are strict about IDs, No IDs no booze.  But people under 21 are welcome as well to this event  - Champions is almost as much a restaurant as a bar and you need not order a drink.


You are responsible for your own consumption and please start and settle your own tab. Please bring your Credit/Debit card or cash and start your tab with the waiter.    Please be sure to tip - we suggest 20% as it is a lot of extra trouble for them to do separate tabs, but it saves us work and allows people to leave at different times.  But first be sure that the tip is not included already - it usually is not but occasionally is, at 18%, if there is a large group, in which case you need not tip additional.  (If you know the price of what you ordered, and add 6.25% MA meals tax, and that is the total, they have NOT added in the tip.)

RSVP required. Please sign up. If you RSVP "Yes," but your plans change, please change your RSVP to "No" so others can sign up. Deadline for reservation is 3PM as we need to get an accurate head count for the reservation. On nights when we are expecting many people, we limit the RSVP number to 27. However, if you'd like to attend, but can't RSVP, send a message to an organizer, as we may be able to get you in.


Champions is located at MIT/Kendall Sq. station. If you come from Boston side, you will see right in front of the T exit. It is part of the Marriott. Even though the address is listed as 50 Broadway, you can really only see it from the Main street side.  We are usually either in the separate room toward the Marriott lobby, or else at two long central tables in the room to the right of the host station.
results.how_to_find_us: We usually make a reservation. Please RSVP by 3pm on the day of the event. Ask hostess for Japanese/English Meetup group.
results.name: Talk over drinks in Kendall Sq. Cambridge

We'll also be celebrating the fact that the 2016 Plone Conference will be in Boston! We'll show the announcement presentation we gave in Bucharest that has the worldwide Plone community super excited to come to our fair city. More details about the conference can be found on this blog post.

• 7:30pm - Plone 5 Demo


Location: MIT Building E14, room 240

If you have any problem finding the room or getting into the building, please call[masked]-8023.

Hope to see you there!

results.description:
The first meeting will take place at the Atlas Lofts Building @ 88 Gerrish Avenue, Chelsea, where a meeting room has been reserved for the group. we also have access to a larger room to prepare/set up for snacks or coffee, etc, which will be available during Thursday's December 10, 2015 meeting. 

There will also be a public group on Facebook, Twitter, and Youtube going up in the few weeks; members will have a chance to have their work spotlighted and shared via the newsfeed and out onto your own and other group pages. 

The General intent of the Meetup is to bring New, General, Historical or Documentary Photographs together in a single database through Social Media Platforms (while retaining individual copyrights)  that will reflect the urban growth of 21st century Chelsea; the strength of the city's neighborhoods, culture and landmarks.

Since the General Intent of this group is Documentation, beginning, amateur and professional photographers, using phones, older or pinhole cameras all the way  to specialized Cameras, are welcome as well as anyone with an interest in helping with organizational, creative or Social Media skills, from teens to adults.

Reservations for the upcoming 2016 year at the library are still being negotiated, but there is always a standby avialable at Atlas Lofts. Remember, Always Carry your Camera!
results.how_to_find_us: Atlas Lofts is at the bottom of Gerrish, a three story Brick Building. Public Parking is Gerrish, Highland, & Library. Gerrish is off Broadway, at Family Dollar, St. Rose of Lima, with a covered bus stop. a short walk from the Library, Dunkin Donuts.
results.name: Chelsea Historical Photographers Meetup @ Atlas Lofts Thursday December 10, 2015

results.description:
Join us at Follow the Honey to bee merry, support local businesses/beekeepers/artists, and take the sting out of holiday shopping!


Admission to the holiday shopping party will be $10 at the door--that $10 will go toward a purchase you make that night! At Follow the Honey, you will find locally-made, unique holiday gifts all in one #ShopSmall HIVE:

Cambridge & Boston honeys from Mike Graney & Andy Baer as well as other luminaries including VP of WCBA association George O’Neil “On Tap”

Artwork by local beekeeper Annie Silverman

French organic honey sweetened macaroons by local pastry chef Shira Melen of Northlight Baking Co.

Beeswax based salves by local Lynn D’Avignon of C’est La Bee

Bee Sweetened Chocolates by Apotheker’s, Liberty, and Pure 7

Freshly poured candles by beekeepers Mary Mansur of TomTen, and Susan Swift of Swift Farm

Jewelry by Austin beekeeper Anna Geiselman of Bee Amour

Books such as The Bee: A Natural History  by Noah Wilson-Rich, etc.

Complimentary wine and cheese pairings, and baked goods (donated on behalf of BABA) will be provided--we encourage shoppers/party-goers to bring holiday goodies to share!

Holiday shopping, sweet treats, and good cheer!

• Enjoy 2 different huge IPAs: the brand new 9% Vic Secret Space Cake Double IPA, this time it's been dry-hopped with Vic Secret hops, giving it a citrusy grapefruit flavor! Also try the Galactica Double IPA, which is one of my all-time favorite IPAs dry hopped with the juicy-fruity Galaxy hops.

• Try the Breakfast Exorcism, this gigantic 11% Imperial Stout is aged in 100% rye barrels and infused with Kalledevarapura Espresso from the folks at Barrington Coffee Roasting! It's also only available on draft at Sunset. 

• Sip on 5 more outstanding brews, like the classic Pecan Pie Porter! 

With so many delicious Clown Shoes brews to try, you will want to get there early! Check out the full beer list and don't forget to RSVP! 

This event is free to attend, pay as you drink.

They'll be serving some fantastic beers.

Hey ladies, here is a great event from our friends at the Boston Asian Entrepreneurship Foundation. See details below...

Come join us for a special guest lecturer Philip Lee with opening remarks from State Representative Donald Wong, on becoming a CEO. Let's get out of the framework of "just doing the job" and instead becoming the "CEO of the job." Our goal is to help you accelerate career growth as well as prepare you to become the face of a company, whether as an entrepreneur or as an intrapreneur. Please RSVP, this event is open for all current and non-CEO's. Space is limited and will fill fast.

Join us after the lecture for a networking mixer thereafter.

</a>

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/how-to-think-act-like-a-ceo-to-propel-your-career-forward-tickets-19526717939

Philip Lee

President & CEO

Lee & Associates

Philip is a senior level executive with extensive experience in clinical research and enterprise software solutions. He has been an experienced CEO for over 18 years driving unprecedented growth and market share expansion. Since 2003 he was President and CEO of PHT Corporation, a leading provider of innovative technology systems used to collect patient-drive eData for clinical research.  Phil grew PHT dramatically from 60 people to over 460 people taking the company from under $5MM in sales and annual losses to well over $100MM in sales and significant profitability.  Earlier this year, Phil successfully sold the company to ERT Corporation providing a very successful exit for his venture investors.  Prior to this, he was also a leading executive at eXcelon Corporation, Clinsoft, BBN Technologies, Interleaf Inc. and Oracle Corporation.

Philip is a strategic thinker and focuses on operational excellence and flawless execution.  He is a leader that seeks to hire the best people in the industry and enable them to thrive by fostering an environment where they can grow and flourish.  Philip’s willingness to mentor and work directly with employees is one of the reasons why his companies have been so incredibly successful.

In both 2012 and 2013, he was a Finalist in the Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year award, a recognition for outstanding entrepreneurs who demonstrate excellence and extraordinary success in areas such as innovation, financial performance and personal commitment to their businesses and communities.  That same year he was named a finalist for Mass TLC’s CEO of the year, Mass High Tech and the Boston Business Journal Tech Luminary of the year, and in 2011, named one of the top 100 Most Inspirational People in Life Sciences.

results.description:
Good News Everyone!

I wanted to do something different for this meetup. December is going to be a busy month for me personally, so I want to post this early. The Chronicles of Prydain series by Lloyd Alexander are classic children high fantasy novels. This series contains five novels (rather short, total length of all five novels is 1057 pages): The Book of Three, The Black Cauldron, The Castle of Llyr, Taran Wanderer, and The High King.

We will be meeting at Comicazi on Highland Ave in Davis Square. There is metered parking all along Highland as well as a public lot on Day Street near Redbones and across the street from Orleans restaurant. There is also T access and bus connections.

You can find The Chronicles of Prydain by Lloyd Alexander on Amazon, B&N, Porter Square Books, or through the Minuteman Library system. Learn about it on Goodreads<a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/13453029-wool-omnibus-silo-1?from_search=true"></a>.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in the back of the shop among the action figures.

results.description:
*** NOTE *** MEETING LOCATION CHANGED. WE'LL NOW BE MEETING AT PRECINCT KITCHEN IN THE BACK BAY (SIP was already booked up.)

Come join us over fab food and drinks at PRECINCT KITCHEN as we discuss Fates and Furies, by Lauren Groff! Here's a description:

"Fates and Furies is a literary masterpiece that defies expectation. A dazzling examination of a marriage, it is also a portrait of creative partnership written by one of the best writers of her generation. 

Every story has two sides. Every relationship has two perspectives. And sometimes, it turns out, the key to a great marriage is not its truths but its secrets. At the core of this rich, expansive, layered novel, Lauren Groff presents the story of one such marriage over the course of twenty-four years.

At age twenty-two, Lotto and Mathilde are tall, glamorous, madly in love, and destined for greatness. A decade later, their marriage is still the envy of their friends, but with an electric thrill we understand that things are even more complicated and remarkable than they have seemed. With stunning revelations and multiple threads, and in prose that is vibrantly alive and original, Groff delivers a deeply satisfying novel about love, art, creativity, and power that is unlike anything that has come before it. Profound, surprising, propulsive, and emotionally riveting, it stirs both the mind and the heart."


Hope to see you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Easy access by T, near the Orange and Green Line stops at Back Bay, Arlington, and Copley
results.name: Fates and Furies, by Lauren Groff

group.name: The *Sh*&%t, I forgot to read the Book * Club

results.description:
Check out the show here - I've seen it already and its really excellent!! http://www.citicenter.org/buy/show-listing/once

Winner of eight 2012 Tony Awards including BEST MUSICAL, ONCE is a truly original Broadway experience. Featuring an impressive ensemble of actor/musicians who play their own instruments onstage, ONCE tells the enchanting tale of a Dublin street musician who's about to give up on his dream when a beautiful young woman takes a sudden interest in his haunting love songs.

As the chemistry between them grows, his music soars to powerful new heights... but their unlikely connection turns out to be deeper and more complex than your everyday romance. Emotionally captivating and theatrically breathtaking, ONCE draws you in from the very first note and never lets go. It's an unforgettable story about going for your dreams... not living in fear... and the power of music to connect all of us.

results.description:
Ongoing class in Medieval and Renaissance Longsword in the tradition of Johannes Lichtenauer.


The Longsword is the iconic fantasy Knight's sword - a two-handed, straight blade with a cross guard. The weapon may seem to be simple at first but is in reality a weapon of finesse and skill.


The class covers all the basics of footwork, attacks and defenses. Drills are developed from simple to complex; from rigidly choreographed to open-ended. Timing, distance and judgement are developed.


All classes begin with a Strength & Conditioning program designed to physically prepare one for fighting with the sword. Elements develop agility, core stability and power.

results.description:
Join BYHP for the last Breakfast with a Heathcare Leaders series of the year with Nancy Brown. Register at:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/byhp-breakfast-with-a-healthcare-leader-nancy-brown-tickets-19442303453

Nancy joined Oak HC/FT as Venture Partner in 2014. Nancy is also a mentor for MassChallenge where she helps the next generation of high-impact entrepreneurs grow and succeed.
Prior to joining Oak HC/FT, Nancy was Vice President of Strategy and Business Development for McKesson Technology Solutions. She has more than 25 years of experience in clinical research and automating clinical information systems, combining management, consulting and information technology skills. At McKesson, she was responsible for helping the company develop, acquire and apply new capabilities that position it to lead the industry and accelerate its Better Health 2020™ strategy, helping healthcare networks reduce costs, coordinate care, assume more risk and manage complex payment models.
Previously, Nancy was Chief Growth Officer at MedVentive, which was acquired by McKesson in 2012. Before joining MedVentive, she served as Senior Vice President of Corporate Development of athenahealth and was responsible for identifying opportunities that drive growth and operational improvements. She also held the position of Senior Vice President of Clinical Service and spearheaded the creation of athenahealth’s clinical product line. Prior to joining athenahealth in 2004, she was a senior vice president at McKesson Corporation, focused on marketing and strategic planning. She joined McKesson in 1999 when it acquired a company she co-founded, Abaton.com, a provider of internet-based clinical solutions for the ambulatory market. Earlier, she spent eight years at Harvard Community Health Plan where she held several senior management roles.
results.name: BYHP Breakfast with a Healthcare Leader: Nancy Brown

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball.

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Friday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

results.description:
This coming Friday, between 1 pm - 3 pm, I will be hosting a literary salon at the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum. It is part of artist Lee Mingwei's ongoing project entitled "The Living Room," and his attempt to revive the experience of personal sharing that thrived during Ms. Garden's life. The museum, that hangout of muses, was also her home, after all.  (You can find more information about the project here: http://www.leemingwei.com/projects.php#)

I was asked to bring a personal collection of objects. And since poems are both ideas and objects to me, I decided to share a few. They were written by authors who were born or died on that day, December 11th, though no doubt under very different circumstances. On the line up are: Francesco Algarotti, Alfred de Musset, Grace Paley, Alexander Solzhenitsyn, and Keith Waldrop.

Please stop by, if you have a chance.
results.how_to_find_us: Find me at the Museum's Living Room
results.name: Literary Salon at the Gardner Museum

• moving holiday furniture

http://www.zoonewengland.org/engage/zoolights


Meet Stone Zoo’s reindeer up close during nightly photo opportunities.Enjoy holiday hot chocolate with the reindeer (see registration and full details below).Have your photo taken with Santa (see video below).Lights, Camel, Action!

results.description:
Strangers on a Train

December 11, 2015
5:30 pm – 7:15 pm
Harry and Mildred Remis Auditorium (Auditorium 161)

BUY TICKETS

Strangers on a Train by Alfred Hitchcock (USA, 1951, 101 min.). In Alfred Hitchcock’s adaptation of Patricia Highsmith’s thriller, tennis star Guy Haines (Farley Granger) is enraged by his promiscuous wife’s refusal to finalize their divorce so he can wed senator’s daughter Anne (Ruth Roman). He strikes up a conversation with a stranger, Bruno Anthony (Robert Walker), and unwittingly sets in motion a deadly chain of events. Psychopathic Bruno kills Guy’s wife, then urges Guy to reciprocate by killing Bruno’s father. Meanwhile, Guy is murder suspect number one.

Strangers on a Train will be screened on 35mm film.


Rear Window

December 11, 2015
8:00 pm – 10:00 pm
Harry and Mildred Remis Auditorium (Auditorium 161)

BUY TICKETS

Rear Window by Alfred Hitchcock (USA, 1954, 112 min.). Rear Window is an intriguing, brilliant, and macabre visual study of obsessive human curiosity and voyeurism. Immobile protagonist Jeff Jeffries (James Stewart), confined to his apartment while recovering from a broken leg, becomes fixated on a man whose mysterious behavior has Jefferies convinced that a murder has taken place. The experience is not so much like watching a movie, as like … well, spying on your neighbors. “Hitchcock traps us right from the first … And because Hitchcock makes us accomplices in Stewart’s voyeurism, we’re along for the ride” (Roger Ebert).

Rear Window will be screened on 35mm film

Does not get better than a Hitchcock Double Feature with discussion after. We are incredibly privileged to have access to the best cinema ever produced, at a treasure like the Museum of Fine Arts, with members that provide a deeper appreciation of Hitchcock than any we could experience alone.


If you give yourself the Gift of a Cinematic Experience this Holiday Season, I'll see you at the movies.

John
results.how_to_find_us: We can meetup in the lobby near the theater before they let us in.  If not, look for us sitting in the middle of the 4th, 5th, 6th, or whatever row.  After Rear Window, those still standing will go to UNO for lively discussion
results.name: THE ART OF HITCHCOCK DOUBLE DOUBLE FEATURE

results.description:
Please join me for this evening's, "HOLIDAY INVITATION NIGHT"

Enjoy merchant hospitality, live entertainment, fabulous shopping and dining - and of course the spirit of the holidays - in beautiful and festive downtown Newburyport and The Tannery!!!

 We did this last year, and it was so much FUN!  The downtown area, stores, and venues are all beautifully decorated for the season!  Most stores/venues offer complimentary  libations, snacks - some even had real buffets as you make your way from one to the other & it's FREE! Wow,  a FUN & FESTIVE night out! 

* PLEASE NOTE: I hate to jinx the evening  by writing this, BUT:  Light snow will make this evening even more picture-perfect, but a serious 'storm' will cancel it. If the weather is questionable please make sure to check for any updates prior to heading out. * If for some reason this event gets cancelled, there will be one more Invitation Night before the holiday, and I will try to re-schedule out meet up for the next one.

*This is a SELF-PACED mostly OUTDOOR event. So, PLEASE dress accordingly.It is widespread throughout the downtown area, and people go/walk with at their own pace with whomever they choose. Also, we all have different interests & want to see different things. IT IS VERY HARD TO STAY TOGETHER AS A GROUP!  If this is a problem for anyone, it may not be the best meet up event to participate in. There will be many more-structured events to participate in where we all can stay together as a group.

* 6pm is EARLY for most. This is the time it begins (end time 9:00) If you are unable to join us @ 6? You are welcome to catch up with us anytime. I, and other members will post comments of our location(s) throughout the evening.

 * PARKING: Parking in Newburyport is always an issue. There are parking lots and also on-street parking for a nominal fee. Please keep this in mind, and try to be on time if you wish to start out the evening with the group.

*AFTER: Depending upon interest/ weather/ and more, we will designate a location to all meet up for : drinks,  more food, etc. However, at the time of this writing there is no set plan. *Most locations in Newburyport are unable to accommodate in  a large group on short notice.

" Liability Release - AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING ANY MEETUP WITH THIS GROUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and her heirs, and all members and participants of this Meet up group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meet up. All meet up activities pose inherent risks and dangers. STOP WORRYING, START LIVING

A Public talk with special guest teacher, American Buddhist nun, Gen Choma

FRIDAY | DEC. 11th 


6:00 - 7:30pm 

In this talk, Gen Choma will help us understand how to have a happier and more fulfilling lifestyle, through letting go of worry and mental clutter, and focusing on what is of real importance in our lives.


Happiness does not have to be far away!

Gen Kelsang Choma is senior Teacher and Buddhist nun with the New Kadampa Tradition of Modern Buddhism; she has studied extensively on the Teacher Training Program for 25 years and is qualified to teach both Sutra and Tantra. She is the Resident Teacher at Kadampa Meditation Center San Francisco and is invited to teach nationally.  People enjoy her teachings for their clarity and warmth.

Starting December 1 registration will cost $20 for you and a friend, $15 for just you.
