results.description:
Suitable for photographers at all skill levels.

It's one of our GBNP traditions to shoot the beautiful blue lights at Columbus Park and the holiday decorations at Quincy Market, every December.

If you've done this before, the challenge is to try something different this year: shoot high, or shoot low.  Try a lens with a different focal length than what you usually use.  Try Bokeh,  or a controlled zoom or a detail shot.  If we have clear skies, try urban star trails, or if not, cloud streaks.


This will be weather dependent as always.  We'll meet at 4:30, just after sunset, because blue hour there can be quite lovely.  Some years the security people at Quincy Market are more wound up about tripods there than others.  A nice way to end the evening is hot chocolate inside the warmth of Quincy Market.


You can find prior meetups here and here.


Another suggestion:


Try to make this the over-exposure challenge: Push the exposure way past what you think you should have, create clipped highlights on purpose and try to make it look interesting. Think "light at the end of the tunnel" or "explosion of the Christmas lights". This is also educational, because it will give you more experience figuring out the exposure range. Most beginners and many intermediates routinely underexpose images. There is a fine line (and certainly taste) on where to cut the exposure off and stop clipping highlights, so this exercise might help you settle in quicker on what you feel is "right", but it also gives you an opportunity to push the envelope and find a new arteestic approach. :)

Gotham Christmas:
results.name: 5th Annual Columbus Park Lights and Quincy Market

results.description:
Hi Everyone:

The Ho-Ho-Ho's and Jingling Bells are nearing, so I'll be the first to wish all of you, a very special Happy Holidays!!!  I hope you're invited to many fun and festive parties, and your hearts feel warm and loved, throughout the Holiday Season!!!

For those wanting something a bit different... Here's a twist, to your usual holiday party... for adults only...  I've hosted this Meetup, for the past two years, December 2013 and 2014, and it always turns out to be a blast... so much so, that folks now ask, when I will be posting it again!!!

So, here it is, folks...

If you need an event to go to, or need a break, from all the crazy Christmas / Holiday shopping lines, then come on out and join us, at our 'Naughty Santa Party'!!!

In addition to the potluck part of the party, and I'll get a menu going... it is also a white elephant gift exchange party.

We held our Meetup at the  Koral Café, at the Hyatt, in 2013, then, it was held at a private residence, with more space, to accommodate 150+ members, who attended, in 2014.

This year, it will be held at a private residence, again, but this time, we'll have a limit of 75 members.

Happy Holidays to all, we'll get your hearts racing!!!  I look forward to enjoying this fun event with you!!!

Cheers,

Rosemarie

White Elephant Gift Exchange Rules:


• Each participant brings a wrapped gift, and gifts are placed in a central area

• Participant 1, will open a wrapped gift, then their turn ends

• Participant 2, will have the option to 'steal' the gift from Participant 1, or, open a gift from the unopened gift pile

• Participant 3, will have the option to 'steal' the gift from Participant 1 or 2, or, open a gift from the unopened gift pile

• Participant 4, 5, 6, etc..., repeat steps, above

• When a participant's gift is 'stolen', they may steal another person's gift or select a replacement gift from the pile of wrapped gifts • The game is over, when the last participant has taken their turn

• Note: The goal of this White Elephant Gift Exchange party is, to entertain, and make this event as enjoyable as possible

• So, choose or put together, a 'Naughty Santa' gift that will be desirable. If a 'Naughty Santa' gift is desirable, it will be 'stolen' multiple times, and will make this game more fun!!! ( Hint: your 'Naughty Santa' gift could be creative, funny, naughty, etc..., and, no gift cards, let's have fun with this... )

• Gift price: Between $10 - $20 or more...

 *** MENU LIST FOR OUR NAUGHTY SANTA PARTY  ***

• Alfajores....caramel center cookies ( patty )

• bacon wrapped chestnuts  ( mark )

• caesar salad ( kelli )

Your Karaoke Host,

results.description:
The trailer for this looks awesome!  I love a monster movie and this is quite a classic monster story!

Showtime is 7:30, I will get to the theater by  6:30 and will be near the ropes by the concession stand until they let us into the inner lobby.   The group will head in for seats as soon as they let us.  This is showing in the IMAX theater downstairs which is very confusing and has really bad cell phone reception.   Showing up late and using the meetup site to try to find the group will not work well.  Come early if you want to sit with the group.

In general, I arrive at the theater an hour before the show to start gathering people, and we head in for seats about 30 minutes before the show, so we can sit together. This also allows us to take turns getting snacks, etc., before the previews start.  It also allows for any unexpected, last minute changes at the theater.  Although fairly infrequent, having wiggle room to exchange tickets, etc. is VERY helpful.

Please note, everyone is responsible for buying their own tickets.  And while it is possible to buy your ticket at the door, shows often sell out. I strongly advise you to buy your tickets in advance.  Tickets are on sale now on Fandango.

If you miss the group ahead of time, come find us after. We gather in the hallway outside of the theater we just saw the movie in, to discuss the film a bit, allow for restroom breaks and to get a head count of all those who would like to go out after for drinks and munchies.

$$$$Managing the after event is much easier if everyone brings cash, so please plan ahead if you want to go out with the group after.  We will be splitting one bill for the group.$$$

One more thing, please keep your rsvp's up to date so I can plan the after event and know who to look for.  Thanks!

Movie Details:

Release date: December 11, 2015

Studio: Warner Bros. Pictures

Director: Ron Howard

Starring:  Chris Hemsworth, Benjamin Walker, Cillian Murphy, Ben Whishaw, Tom Holland, Brendan Gleeson and Jordi Molla

Genre: Drama, Adventure

Plot Summary: 

Warner Bros. Pictures has revealed the trailer for Ron Howard’s In the Heart of the Sea, starring Chris Hemsworth, Benjamin Walker, Cillian Murphy, Ben Whishaw, Tom Holland, Brendan Gleeson and Jordi Molla. 


In the winter of 1820, the New England whaling ship Essex was assaulted by something no one could believe: a whale of mammoth size and will, and an almost human sense of vengeance. The real-life maritime disaster would inspire Melville’s Moby-Dick. But that told only half the story. In the Heart of the Sea reveals the encounter’s harrowing aftermath, as the ship’s surviving crew is pushed to their limits and forced to do the unthinkable to stay alive. Braving storms, starvation, panic and despair, the men will call into question their deepest beliefs, from the value of their lives to the morality of their trade, as their captain searches for direction on the open sea and his first mate still seeks to bring the great whale down.
results.name: In the Heart of the Sea  (7:30 IMAX 3D Show)

results.description:
Directors of South Shore Dancers will show you some basic dance steps so you can join in at our dance. Lesson is free.


If you want to stay for the dance which begins at 7:30 pm, the cost is $12.00 for entry, which includes a bountiful snack table and non-alcoholic beverages.

At 7:30 pm the dance begins with an intermediate-level dance lesson. You're certainly welcome to try that too, but if it seems a little too advanced at the point, it's a great time to grab some goodies from the snack table and do a little mingling and introduce yourself. Then at 8:00 pm the general dancing begins. Each night includes a couple of line dances, some ladies' choice dances, and a 1/2 hour dance host program, where several men (and perhaps a lady) will be identified as a dance host and anyone is welcome to ask for a dance.

We also have a nightly waltz or fox trot mixer. In the mixer the ladies line up and the men come up to escort each lady around the floor for one turn, then drop them off at the end of the line and start all over a gain. It's a great way to meet some of the other dancers, and also to practice your skills. Don't hesitate to jump in line, and just let your partner know "I'm new at all this" if that's the case.


Each month's dance has a "theme", and dancers are encouraged (but not required!) to dress accordingly. Our theme for December is "Joyeux Noël", so wear something reflecting France/Christmas/Holidays.
results.how_to_find_us: Cushing Memorial Hall is on route 123 in Norwell center.
results.name: Join South Shore Dancers for a free ballroom dance lesson.

results.description:
Ring in the holiday season - literally - with a special performance by the Merrimack Valley Ringers, accompanied by Bay Colony Brass. The Ringers are a group of 16 musicians playing handbells, and Bay Colony Brass is one of the few large brass ensembles (or brass choirs) of its kind in the United States. From the information on the website, their concerts are free (except when noted as a fundraiser).

http://mvringers.org/about-mvr/

http://www.baycolonybrass.org/about-1/

After the concert, we can grab a drink or bite to eat nearby.

For those of you who haven't been to one of my events...when I add "guests" (such as +12) to my RSVP, those represent members of other Meetup groups who will be joining us.
results.name: Holiday Handbell & Brass Concert

Well, it's time to head back to Meadhall and enjoy some good beer in the spirit of the holidays. Here's the agenda:

Show up at 7:30pm or later

Meet people, drink beer, discuss a broad range of topics (not necessarily in that order)

Drink more beer

MeadHall is one of the best Beer Bars in Boston. It has over 100 quality beers on tap. It's located in Kendal Square not far from the Red Line T stop. (around the corner from the Marriott Hotel)

There are two levels to MeadHall.  On first level is the main tap room and bar. The second level has a nice lounge area and another bar. We'll meet at the second level lounge since it will give us more room and a nice area to socialize.

Here's the link: http://themeadhall.com/

Don't worry the site is still under construction (been that way for 2 years) but at least it provides the address and phone number.

Looking forward to seeing everyone - Happy Holidays

results.description:
Let's Play Dodgeball!

Remember when you used to get a lunch break AND recess? Let'slationships were formed while we were playing games-we made friends, scores were settled, and we figured out how to interact with the opposite sex. Well, some of us did :)

https://youtu.be/QPDs4zs3kzw

Remember when you used to get a lunch break AND recess? Let's return to our glory days for some school yard fun! So many relationships were formed while we were playing games-we made friends, scores were settled, and we figured out how to interact with the opposite sex. Well, some of us did :)

Worried about being branded with the logo from the rubber ball? Well, don't...we use soft squishy balls…without a visible logo :) So, if you really hope to get a tattoo, you'll have to find another way.

Dodgeball Details: Teams are chosen round robin style, so it doesn't matter if you ruled the schoolyard at one point. There won't be any awkward "I hope I'm chosen before the kid in the full body cast". The "rules" will be explained by the referee before playing starts. They aren't complex, and there won't be any instant replays for controversial calls.

It's designed to be fun, playful, and casual. The only rule I can remember is not aiming for someone's head. Ladies, I can't guarantee that the guys are going to follow that one : ) Guys, this is still not the best way to get a woman's attention….

All levels are welcome! We will be playing on a padded floor, wearing socks (remember to bring socks!). The arena is air conditioned and is smaller than a typical dodgeball court.

Dodgeball of Boston is located at 1 Broadway in Arlington, MA. There is a small parking lot, emphasis on small, and free street parking available on the side streets. Public transportation is probably the easiest way to get there. It's about one mile from Davis Sq Redline T and Alewife T Stations.

Cost: $10. PLEASE try to pay with a $10 bill, or some combination that adds up to $10 ($5 bills, $1 bills, etc…), as change is hard to make. The cover goes to pay the rent for the space.

After Dodgeball: We will head for drinks/appetizers nearby at:

Orleans Restaurant 
65 Holland Street 
Davis Square, Cambridge

We always have a lot of fun there too, drinking, eating and singing karaoke, and it's a great way to enjoy Friday night!

This will be a joint event with other meet up groups, please only RSVP in one group.

IMPORTANT: Please be sure to bring socks with you in order to play!

--Carla & Matt 
;-)

https://youtu.be/cXmt_iFLd58

results.description:
It's a bird? It's a plane? Nope, it's Boston A-List's Best Night of Comedy, THE MENDOZA LINE!

This and every Saturday night live from the back room of the The Dugout Cafe (722 Comm Ave), John Baglio, Julia Claire, and Zach "Zack" Armentrout bring you a different lineup stacked with the biggest, baddest, and bestiest comedians from Boston and beyond. And guess what? Its only FIVE DOLLARS! With drink specials as far as the eye can see and free popcorn, this intimate atmosphere is the perfect place to take in some meaningful and quality laughs!

This week's show features the comedic talents of:

EMILY RUSKOWSKI (Maria Bamford)

SAM IKE (Milwaukee Comedy Festival)

MATT MCKEWAN (Visiting from NYC)

OWEN LINDERS (Thunderbar Comedy)

DAN BOULGER (Comedy Central, Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson)

THOM CROWLEY (Boston Comedy Festival, Birthday Boy)

AND MORE!

Buy your tix now to guarantee a seat as spaces are limited. We don't want to turn you away again Carmelo!

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-mendoza-line-bostons-best-weekly-comedy-showcase-tickets-15228587114

results.description:
We go out the Bog Trail to check out Pine Hole Pond , then we'll do a loop around and over Holt Hill(views to Boston)

Approx. hiking time: 3 to 3.5 hours max. Please don't RSVP "Yes" unless you really intend to come. We are committed to being there for you. If you are not equally committed to being there then please don't sign up.

This hike is rated intermediate, This is a group event and participants are expected to follow the lead, stay together, stop at junctions or summits, and support all participants should circumstances require teamwork. We start together and finish together. If you decide to leave the group at any time, you are on your own. We hike in light rain or showers, but heavy snow or extreme cold weather cancels. Bring water, hiking boots (not sneakers), bug spray and lunch/snacks. Protect yourself against deer ticks and dress in layers.

No dogs and no guests are allowed on hikes. Have your guest join the group so they can agree to the liability waiver and attend an event.

Please remember that your Event Organizers are volunteers, the event is free and we are all adults. The people who have the best times on these hikes are those who stay loose and roll with things as they happen. If you are expecting Daniel Boone as your leader, you’re barking up the wrong tree. If you need everything to run perfectly, this hike is not for you.

By clicking the "Yes" option on the RSVP link you are agreeing to the Liability Waiver as stated below:

Remember: Your Event Organizers are volunteers. You are solely responsible for your own safety and enjoyment. As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you have read and agree to adhere to the safety standards detailed @ http://www.hikesafe.com/; the organizer(s) of this activity is a volunteer; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

 DIRECTIONS Take exit 41 to Rt. 125N for 5.0 mi. turn R on Prospect St. Follow to end.

results.description:
Meet to paint the model for a four week pose- Members (those paying the $25 monthly membership fee) may reserve a spot for $65, non-members for $75.    Three hours each Sunday morning, 9:30-12:30.  You can come individual days by paying $15 (members) or $25 (non-members) for a single drop-in, but please consider paying for the full amount and committing to come!  It will help us to keep these long sessions going, and even if you pay for the whole session and don't come to all of them (often happens), you're getting a pretty square deal.  If you would like to pay online please do so at


http://damonlehrer.com/damonlehrer.com/payment.html 

PLEASE TRY TO BE ON TIME-  folks who come later than 10:00 am will be admitted ONLY at the convenience of the host (who is busy painting). PLEASE NOTE THE PRICES BELOW- They are deliberately a bit higher than for drawing sessions as we keep the studio less crowded for painting, and it's more work to put together a four week pose.  

----- IF THE CAPACITY REACHES 12, whether or not that number shows up on the RSVP list, we may have to close the session to further drop-ins to preserve breathing space for those who reserved ahead. ------

 Please consider that for $65 or $75 (non-member) you can reserve ahead for the whole month, which helps us stay open for business.  If you want to drop in, you can RSVP and pay online- simply change the amount of the payment at the payment stage to reflect the drop-in rate above.

results.description:
We will hike Hickory Hills Forest. This is approx 3.5 miles round trip and takes just about an hour and fifteen minutes. It is a nice hike mostly on Cart paths. We will meet at 156 S. Row Road, in Lunenburg Hike over to the trail head and make our way around the forest. Wear sturdy shoes or boots. Socially behaved dogs are welcome, please bring your own doggie bags.
Directions.
From the center of Lunenburg
Rte 2A East Approx 3/4 mile turn left onto Townsend Harbor Road.
Travel approx 1/2 mile on Townsend Harbor Road to the stop sign. Turn left at the stop sign to continue on Townsend Harbor Road.
Travel approx another 1/2 mile at the fork stay left onto South Row Road. Follow South Row Road for approx 1/2 mile.
My house is on the right.
Uturn Driveway, Brown house. Pull right into the driveway.

results.description:
LIMIT: 6 participants (excluding the event hosts).  You must RSVP here (or, if you are not a meet-up member e-mail Laurie at [masked]). (The number will also go down as we take reservations from the facebook page and Christna's students.)


Come a few minute early to grab a coffee and donut, then we'll do some carting!  We'll go over types of carting, proper harness & cart fitting and introductory training exercises, then proceed to do some pulling and/or draft test maneuvers for dogs that are ready.  Beginners welcome! 


The venue has two indoor rooms and a big outdoor area so we'll be good to go no matter what the weather.

If there is interest we will travel about 3 miles to the Oak Grove recreational area for a 1-mile cart-pull through the woods on a nice wide track.  Beginners are encouraged to walk their dogs with the group to get used to the sounds and sight of the carts.

Fee: $10.00 cash or check at the event.

TEAM: One person and one dog.  If there is some reason you would like to bring another person or dog, please contact Laurie at [masked]

SPECTATORS: If you would like to watch at no fee, please contact Laurie at [masked]

If we end up having great weather and will be outside all spectators will be welcome.


THANKS to Christina and Chili for hosting us at their venue!

results.description:
Get ready for another SUNDAY meetup at Peter's Park! (weather permitting)

Meetup dues are $3 per Frenchie, this covers the $14.99 monthly fee to host our meetup.com group online. In the case that I can not make it to this event please either pay at the next meetup or preferably via the "Chip in" button on the left hand side of this page.

Your Frenchie's canine brothers, sisters and friends are more than welcome to join us at the park!

Greater Boston Oasis meets every week for engaging speakers, live musicians, and the opportunity to connect with the community. Details of the speakers, musical guests, etc. will be posted in the individual meetups as they are confirmed.

Doors for the event open at 10:00 AM for coffee and conversation, with the program starting at 10:30. We hope to see you there!

=========================================

Oasis meets in the Teen Center at the YMCA. To find the room, enter through the lower entrance (on Dartmouth Street, by the swimming pool), and follow Oasis signs from the front lobby to the Teen Center on the second floor. (Note: the stairwell to the Teen Center is NOT the stairwell in the front lobby. That is Stairwell A. The Teen Center is located at Stairwell B, next to the Yoga Studio. Oasis volunteers will be available to help provide assistance, and signage will be posted.

=========================================

Greater Boston Oasis is a secular community dedicated to providing for the human need for social and intellectual community, for those people who may not want or be able to have those needs met in a church or other faith-based community. 

Our Core Values are:

People are more important than beliefs


Reality is known through reason


Meaning comes from making a difference


Human hands solve human problems


Be accepting, and be accepted

Atheist or agnostic, freethinker or skeptic, deist or theist, all those with whom those values resonate are welcome to celebrate the human experience.
results.how_to_find_us: Follow signs from the entrance to the Teen Center room. Use the Dartmouth Street entrance, and head to Stairwell B. Teen Center is on the 2nd floor.

results.description:
About the film:

Out of the blue Anna, an actress at a provincial community theater, gets fired. Fresh off the stage, she suddenly finds herself at the local job center.
On the urging of her theater-mad case worker, she takes on an acting course for seven “hard-to-place clients“ - as a compulsory training measure. Overcoming huge resistance, Anna forms the bunch of frustrated lone wolves into a group and starts to rehearse Antigone with them. This gives new impetus to the participants’ own private dramas, while Anna too experiences a sort of “comeback” for which she wasn’t quite prepared. A Godsend is a tragicomedy, where the stage is the setting for a collective restoration of the self-respect lost by each of the individuals. Directed by Oliver Haffner.


After the movie we'll go to an area restaurant for a discussion.

Hope you can make it!

Lisa

results.description:
Our December topic: It's all about the food, baby!

December will be all about Dim Sum and just enjoying each other's company. After all, it's CHRISTMAS / FESTIVUS / HANNUKAH / KWANZAA / RAMADAN / WINTER SOLSTICE, ad infinitum. I say, let's just eat and celebrate!


This is an end of the year brunch-mingle that I hope will become an annual event. If there's a specific topic you'd like to revisit from an earlier Brunch for Thought or Food for Thought event, feel free to bring it up at the table. The RSVP limit for this event will be expanded, so you're welcome to have a conversation with the people seated directly around you. We won't think you're rude. We probably won't be able to hear you!

Eat. Talk. Enjoy. Bring cash.

Hope to see you there!


===============================================


Brunch Menu <-- Scroll down the page to the "Dim Sum" section. If you've experienced dim sum before, you know what to expect. If you haven't, Google "dim sum" for an idea of Chinese small plate dining.

Here's an internet review from 2013: Winsor Dim Sum 


And there's this: The Serious Eats Guide to Dim Sum

===============================================

                              Food Allergies and Preferences

Dim Sum is not gluten-friendly and is not particularly vegetarian in the strictest sense of that term. I found this explanation from a Google search that sums it up nicely:


-----

       "If I had celiac disease, I would probably avoid dim sum  altogether, due to risk of cross-contamination. The wrappers of dumplings often have gluten, the steamed buns definitely do, and generic soy sauce is made with wheat...."

-----

Pay special attention to the term "cross-contamination" in that paragraph if you are a strict vegetarian or vegan as well. Here's another quote worth sharing:

-----

       "... dim sum is particularly challenging because, as you know, soy sauce almost always contains gluten. You'll need to bring your own specially made gluten-free soy sauce and avoid any dishes that are flavored with soy sauce.

       "Beyond that, you have a problem in that the most common dim sum items are dumplings of various types, and nearly all of them contain wheat. If you know how to recognize them, taro dumplings should be safe; sticky rice bundles; turnip and taro cake; fried or steamed rolls made with tofu skin; tofu pudding; fried sweet sticky rice balls. The meat dishes are commonly made with soy sauce or Worcestershire, both of which frequently contain gluten. As a result, you should avoid those."

-----

Please feel free to do your own research and consider the above information when you make your decision whether or not to join us for this event. Also, keep in mind Brunch for Thought etiquette (last bullet item on page). 

===============================================

                                         $$$ About Money $$$

Managing restaurant events is so much easier when everyone brings cash, so please plan ahead:

(1) BRING CASH.

(2) Because dim sum is shared by all the people at a table, we will split one bill for the food cost EVENLY (including the food tax and tip) --NO separate checks--NO exceptions. That means you'll only have to figure out the cost of your own drinks + tax and tip, and then add that amount to your share of the food total.

(3) PLEASE BRING CASH!

(4) Tax on food in Boston is 6.25%; minimum tip expected for a group at Boston restaurants is 18%. Plan to add 25% to your food and drink total to cover YOUR share of BOTH tax and tip.

(5) !!! DON'T FORGET TO BRING CASH !!!

==============================================

In the spirit of the season and for the sake of the people on our waiting list, PLEASE keep your RSVP up-to-date!


Brunch for Thought FAQs <-- REVISED - PLEASE READ
results.name: Brunch for Thought-December: Dim Sum!

results.description:
When you stop to think about it, Christmas themed horror films can be a rather small subgenre. You have "Black Christmas," the "Silent Night, Deadly Night" franchise, "Gremlins," "Rare Exports," and then......not much else. Thankfully Michael Dougherty, the writer/director of the horror anthology "Trick 'r Treat," decided to fill that gap with "Krampus," a film where a bickering family must band together to survive an attack from the anti-Santa Claus.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h6cVyoMH4QE

Boston Horror Society will be hosting an afternoon screening of "Krampus" on Sunday the 13th at the AMC Loews on 175 Tremont Street. There is a 12:45 PM showing of the movie that day. I plan to be in the lobby with a Meetup sign about twenty minutes before the movie starts. When the group is all together, we can get snacks and seats.

Once the movie ends, we have the option to stop at a nearby restaurant or bar and discuss "Krampus" or anything else horror related.

Looking forward to seeing some of you on Sunday!

results.description:
it’s a party! It’s a donation drop-off site for gently-used kids’ clothing and toys! It’s a potluck dinner! It’s music and face painting! It’s sitting on Santa’s knee! It’s playing a dreidel game. It’s a holiday dinner food drive! It’s a drive for new or gently-used household goods! It’s the place where folks bring the gift(s) to fulfill a child’s wish list.

The Operation ELF Holiday Gathering is the highpoint of the organization’s charitable efforts every year. This event is an opportunity for the many volunteers and their families to come together and celebrate the season and the community’s ability to bring the joy of the season to the less fortunate.

Volunteers produce this event starting weeks in advance. Men and women join forces to gathering requests from the charities, organizing them, and distributing the wish lists to gift sponsors. These giving people go shopping and fill each child’s request, and perhaps do even a little bit more.

Other teams handle decorating the event site, organizing transportation and gift delivery, sorting and packing of everything the day of the event, entertaining the volunteers’ children during the event, and providing a feast to nourish the body while the event nourishes the spirit.

In addition, there are many other activities to make this a true family event/celebration. These include:

Holiday music to celebrate the season
Potluck Feast (bring food ready to serve!)
Activities for the kids
And a visit from Santa Claus
Family photo station
results.name: Operation ELF: Holiday Celebration

results.description:
Please join us for a pleasant afternoon of competitive party bridge.

If possible, RSVP by Saturday. At least 5 "Yes" responses are needed by then to avoid cancelling the next day's game. (Last-minute attendance is perfectly fine, too, but let us know to expect you so that we may provide enough tables and cards.) 

You must know Contract Bridge rules and basic bidding to play. No formal training will be offered, but this is a social, casual event, and bidding advice and meanings will be openly discussed at any player's request.

ACBL Yellow Card is our group-standard bidding system; a novice should please take time to study all basic openings and responses shown above, plus standard Jacoby Transfer and Stayman responses to NT openings. We will expect a verbal alert on deviations an expert may make to these most-common conventions.

Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white t-shirt and a colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a dark or white "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, pinnies, sunscreen, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!

results.description:
Event:
Our monthly Boston Area Furry Luncheon

When:
Every second Sunday of each month, at 1:00PM.

The next luncheon will be held on
Sunday, December 13, 2015
For those of you who need a month’s notice, the following luncheon will be held on:
Sunday, January 10, 2015 Where:
The 99 in Chalestown
29-31 Austin Street; Charlestown, MA[masked]
Phone: (617)[masked] . It’s a short walk from the Community College T stop, on the Orange Line, and there is plenty of free parking. The prices for meals are reasonable. Finally, there’s free popcorn for those of you who can’t afford a full meal and vegetarian options for us herbivores. Just ask the wait staff. ^!^

For more details, you can go to: http://www.99restaurants.com/ .

(Sorry to say it, but we’ve got to have) Rules:
We don’t need to make a reservation, thus there is no need to RSVP (and hardly anyone ever does). Just simply show up.

No one under the age of 16 will be admitted. No one of ages 16 or 17 will be admitted without permission from their parents. The PDF’s for the permission slips are posted here: https://www.furaffinity.net/view/5929875/ please follow the instructions provided. I know this may sound silly, but I’m just trying to prevent the possibility of any sort of trouble.

I know there are those of you who are dying to wear your fursuits or your partials. I’m afraid that’s not the purpose of this event. The purpose of this event is to create an opportunity for us to get to know each other. The presence of something like a fursuit may make someone, who is new to the group, uncomfortable. Furry artwork, illustrated clothing, convention badges, ears, tails and even collars will be allowed. After all, it will help someone new find our group! ^.^ If anyone feels uncomfortable because the rest of our are "showing too much furry pride," please bring the matter up with me, first.

Note: It is not essential, but I’m encouraging each and every one of us to tip. This will ensure that we maintain a good relationship with the staff. The minimum wage for “tipped services” is about half that of other forms of employment. Therefore, most waitstaff rely heavily on tips, as their source of income. An average tip would be between 15% and 20% of the total cost of your meal. If you need any help calculating this amount, please let us know. Also, I can teach short-cuts for doing this in one’s head. ^!^

Questions, Comments, and Contact Info:
If you have any questions or comments, feel free to send me a Note.

Also, if you would like to lend a paw, claw, hoof, wing, fin, tentacle, mandible, or whatever, in coordinating this event, I’ll be glad to hear from you. ^!^

results.description:
To celebrate the holiday season, you are cordially invited to an afternoon of food, games and crazy gift-giving at Not Your Average Joe's in Medford.  We are going eat, drink and be merry today.

Check out some of the pics from previous C&C Yankee swap events:

 Although you don't have to participate in the Yankee Swap to come, there won't be as many games as usual due to the festivities.  It'll be more 'conversation' than 'cards' at this event!

 WHAT'S A YANKEE SWAP?

To participate in the Yankee Swap, you will need to bring a wrapped, unmarked gift ~$10-$15 (it doesn't have to be a game, and unusual or wacky gifts are always fun). Guests will be given numbers as they arrive, and they select and unwrap gifts from the pile in that order — with a twist....

The person who receives the number 1 will pick a gift (that is not their own) from the pile and open it for all to see (or models it, reads it, or demos it). During the selection of a wrapped gift, the participant may visually inspect the gifts, pick them up and/or gently shake them.

The person who receives number 2 then chooses a gift and opens it, and then must decide whether to keep it or swap it for the first player’s gift.

Each person in order then gets to select a present, open it and decide whether to keep it or swap it for any other gift someone has already opened. Opening of gifts and swapping takes place until all the presents have been chosen. Finally, the person who picked first gets to choose from all the gifts or keep what he/she has already received. In the end, the gift you are holding is the gift you take home.

TIPS ON WINNING A YANKEE SWAP

Always buy something that you want – there is a good chance that you could end up with your own gift…shop accordingly. Make sure what you purchase for the Yankee Swap is something that you wouldn’t mind walking out of there with.

Be shrewd – If you see a gift that you want…take it. I don’t care if you are taking a gift away from your grandmother that she absolutely loves…take it. She would do it to you BELIEVE ME.

Be a loud mouth and point out to everything else how awesome that other gift someone else has so no one will pay attention to the one you already have and want to keep. Otherwise sit low and out of the way so no one will see what you have unless someone asks to hold up all the gifts. Then just don’t hold it up too high. Got it? 

HOw TO GET THERE

This location is easily accessible from Rt. 16, Rt. 28 and Rt. 93, and is walking distance from the T, near the new Station Landing apartment complex. Here is a map of the area.

By Subway: Take the Orange Line to Wellington. Walk over the skybridge and cross through the parking lot. Upon exiting the garage, you'll see a building complex (SL75) across the street. Cross the street and take a right. Follow around this building and you'll find Not Your Average Joe's on the opposite side of the street.

By Car: If you are driving, be aware that Station Landing is at the intersection of Rt. 16 and Rt. 28, and you can enter the Station Landing complex from the north-bound side of Rt. 28, or the east-bound side of Rt. 16. There are a number of stores in the Station Landing complex -- look for the Margarita's, Starbucks or Not Your Average Joe's signs. NYAJ is located right off of Rte. 28.

Although there is free parking all around the building, we recommend that C&C members park in the garage underneath the restaurant.

results.description:
Come join the Somerville Arts Council for our inaugural cooking class at Union Kitchen. Our star cooking instructor Estela Calzada hails from Durango Mexico and brings years of cultural knowledge and cooking experience for a one day cross cultural food exchange. Calzada (of breakfast tamale pop-up fame) explains that the Aztecs would sacrifice people as a gift to the corn gods, in hopes of better corn crops. Because corn was so important to the Aztec belief system, dishes featuring corn, like pozole, took on a ritual significance. These days, pozole is eaten all over Mexico, especially on September 26th, the day of Mexican Independence. Estela's signature pozole features corn ( large hominy kernals ) pork, chile ancho, chile guajillo, garlic and onion, and topped off with shredded lettuce, radishes, oregano and lime—to suit your individual taste. to accompany our Pozole,Estela will teach students how to make a delicious Ponche; a traditional fruit punch served during Christmas time to warm you up when the grasp of winter is at it's strongest. Join Estela and the Somerville Arts Council for a festive afternoon of Mexican culture and cuisine, and say adios to winter with this Pozle and Ponche class!

Tickets ($40) can be purchased on Eventbrite linked below. Hope to see you all there!
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/mexican-pozole-cooking-class-tickets-19501853569

Nick Schonberger
Culinary Coordinator
Somerville Arts Council
[masked]

http://www.somervilleartscouncil.org/

results.description:
Hi all this is an impromptu pre holiday party at our home in Tewksbury. We will be ordering Pizza to keep things simple. If you come over around three just when it gets dark Rockvale street just behind us is majestically a Christmas wonderland . It will be 60 degrees all weekend. WE can walk over to Rockvale check out the street in all its glory and then come back for Game night watching. I guess the game is at 830 against the Texans. Please bring light snacks and liquid to help feed the fuel.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jnyp1411Rkw


 


 Oh, little town of Tewksbury

How brightly shine your lights

And Rockvale Road at Christmastime

Boasts such astounding sights!

 For in that dark street shineth

A multitude of light

The hopes and dreams of young and old

Are realized tonight!

TEWKSBURY - The magic of Christmas shines brightly on Rockvale Road in Tewksbury with the extraordinary display of more than 100,000 lights at the Dascoli residence.  Neighbors add to the enchantment with astounding displays on almost every house on that street. Cars -- filled with children young and old -- marvel at the incredible sights as they wait in line to see magnificent displays of dazzling lights.

 The story of Rockvale Road’s amazing Christmas lights began for Mike Dascoli fifteen years ago when he started decorating his home for the holidays.

 “I started out small with my decorations but, after my Dad passed on, I started to expand the display.  Christmas was his favorite holiday.  It brings me great enjoyment to do it because, while I’m putting up the lights, I think about him.  I think he would love these lights.  So, I guess it really is in honor of him that I do it,” explained Dascoli. 

 Most of the neighbors enjoy decorating for Christmas, too, and, like Dascoli, they just laugh about the added traffic and say to each other that it’s only for the month of December, so they can live with it.

 You can enter the wondrous world of holiday lights if you go to Rockvale Road from about 4:30 in the afternoon until 9:30 p.m. or until 10:00 p.m. on the weekends. 

Dascoli says, “On Christmas Eve we keep them on until 12:00 a.m. for the people who want to stop by on the way to Midnight Mass.  We turn our lights on every year on the Friday after Thanksgiving and leave them on until New Years Eve – weather permitting.”

 “I put all the lights on and the displays up by myself except for the big trees.  Chuck’s Tree Service comes here every Thanksgiving morning with his bucket truck and we decorate the trees,” adds Dascoli.

Dascoli’s wide variety -- of more than 100,000 lights and countless displays -- includes a family of Snowmen, Mickey Mouse & friends, Santa Claus, huge blow-up figures and much, much more.

Several years ago, Dascoli started collecting donations at his house to benefit local organizations.  Over the years he has donated the money collected in a wishing well at the end of his driveway to the Tewksbury Senior Center, the Tewksbury Recreation, and the Tewksbury Community Pantry.

In keeping with the theme of his extravagantly decorated house, Dascoli’s wishing well has beautiful lights and an illuminated teddy bear with a sign that reads, “We hope our display of lights brings a smile to your face and joy to your hearts…  This year’s wishing well proceeds will be given to the Tewksbury Community Pantry.  Over the years, Dascoli estimates that he’s collected more than $10,000 for charity.

Unfortunately, last year a thief tried to steal the joy of Christmas by knocking over the wishing well and absconding with about $200.  Well, everyone knows you can’t steal the spirit of Christmas so one of Santa Claus’s helpers, Kraft Power in Woburn, stopped by to help the Dascoli family continue to collect donations for the charity of their choice. Kraft Power donated the use of a generator for the lights and replaced the wishing well with a larger, sturdy one.

Dascoli starts stringing more than 100,000 lights the day after Halloween and his wife, Pattie, estimates the cost to light their Christmas display from November to January at about a $1,000 a year.

Over the years, Dascoli has been dubbed as “one of the good guys” by many residents of Tewksbury.  He keeps adding to his display as well as replacing figures that get tattered and worn. He does it for his family – his wife, Pattie, twin boys, Kevin and Keith, daughter, Deanna and youngest son, Michael. Michael serves in the Marine Corp and has just finished boot camp. He will come home from Parris Island this week.  But the newest addition to the Dascoli family this year is grandson, Justin Keough who is just 10 months old.

“This year is really special because I’m doing it for Justin so he can enjoy the lights,” says Dascoli, with great pride.

And so, Dascoli’s labor of love (to light up his little corner of the world) continues -- to the incredible delight of all who travel down Rockvale Road during Christmas time!


http://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/homenewshere.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/c/eb/ceb71a00-2282-11e1-88ed-001871e3ce6c/4ee23724b1a22.image.jpg?resize=300%2C201
results.name: Pre Football hangout w/Amazing Xmas Display at our home in Tewksbury

The oldest, established, permanent floating Community Walk in Cambridge and environs.

Please join the Fresh Pond Community walkers + five other meetup groups for this delightful sunset walk. 

Let's join 20+ walkers and some other walking groups for:

Over 3 years of reliable walking

Please note that this walk does not start at the same place as the other Fresh Pond walk.

We'll go out to dinner at a local pub or chinese restaurant - you can get a decent dinner for under $10.

Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

You can get there by T easily from Harvard Square, take the 71 OR 73 bus to Aberdeen Ave, then walk to the other end of Aberdeen Ave, and you'll see us there. We'll be next to the bridge, on the pond side of Huron Ave,at the intersection of Aberdeen Ave.

If you're late, and we've already started, start walking counter-clockwise. We'll be walking clockwise, so we'll surely bump into each other. We're the large group of vigorously chatting walkers.

Hope to see you there.

NOTE: Every once a while, the location may change. PLEASE look on the website each week for confirmation. THANKS!


To get to the Meetup, take the RED LINE stop OUTBOUND TO ALEWIFE, and stop at PORTER SQ. Panera Bread is right next to Dunkin Donuts. If you're driving, you can park on the street for free on Sundays!

Anyone who loves ASL is welcome to come and be part of the fun! We want to warmly extend an invitation to Deaf people or others fluent/skilled in the language (CODAs for example) to join our group.

This is an easy-going, casual, ASL get-together to meet people who enjoy American Sign Language, who want to brush up on their signing skills, and want to learn more ASL by using it as often as possible.

We strive to have a good time and communicate without using voices. If we need to, we draw or write what we don't know how to sign, and if lots of folks show up, we split up into small groups and mix and mingle, so we can actually see one another clearly, face-to-face and get a good conversation going.

Don't be afraid or shy if you're not "perfect" at ASL, because being "perfect" is not the point of this group. No one expects that everyone will be at the same level, and none of us mind slowing down or repeating what we have signed so that everyone understands.

We all laugh WITH one another as we fumble along, mess things up, and start over again. This isn't an ASL class, since none of us are certified ASL teachers, so there's really no pressure or expectation--other than that we all use ASL to communicate. We all learn from one another!

IF you've taken an ASL/Sign Language class before (or have had exposure to someone who uses the language) and know the basics (alphabet, numbers 1-20, and even a small vocabulary of signs ), then join us to get your fingers, hands, face and body moving, ASL-style!

IF you haven't taken an ASL class, or don't know the basics, don't be discouraged ... you can come along anyway and learn by watching, and gradually, participating. We have lots of resources that we can suggest for learning ASL from a qualified teacher or authentic source, such as books, online classes, and local classes at various locations near Boston.

If you can, "officially" RSVP, even if the RSVP is "No," so that we know who is definitely going to come.

It will be great to see folks!

Sean
results.how_to_find_us: We will be there signing our beautiful language to inspire all of you!

results.description:
Give yourself the gift of relaxation and rejuvenation with a wonderful 90 minute gentle yoga and meditation class.

True relaxation is experienced by the body and mind when little or no energy is consumed. It is Nature's way of recharging. Since every action, conscious or unconscious, uses stored energy, relaxation is necessary for good health and peace of mind. Without proper relaxation the body and mind become overworked and inefficient.

When the mind is constantly bombarded by stimuli, it becomes overloaded and exhausted. We may be unaware that we are doing it, but by thinking and worrying we are using up tremendous amounts of energy. The tension put on the mind by worries can use more energy than physical work.

Yoga retrains the body to relax and can calm the mind which leads to inner peace.

This class is for beginners and experienced yogi's.  Chairs are available for those who may need to sit during this class.  Please bring your own yoga mat, water and a blanket or pillow for meditation.
results.name: Gentle Yoga & Meditation - 90 minute class

group.name: The Light Within - Yoga, Reiki, Meditation - Dorchester MA

results.description:
Yes, "Feast" is a cookbook club, yet I fully intend to launch a series of Food Swap events. It's another excuse to cook and to get together with you all (a good enough reason for me)!

So here we are in the height of the holiday season. Dare I squeeze in another event?! Yep, I'm going for it.


Please join me for a Food Swap of Holiday Cookies!


If you love to make cookies or love to eat them . . . then this event is for you.


The concept is simple:


1. Pick a single recipe. Yep, just one. It could be a personal favorite, Grandma's secret recipe, or one that you've bookmarked on Pinterest.


2. Next, make a minimum of 3 dozen cookies with your chosen recipe. You can make as many as you want, as long as you bring at least 3 dozen for swapping.


3. Once the cookies have cooled, divide them into separate groups of 6 cookies per group. For example, 48 cookies will make 8 groups. If only math could always be so delicious, right?

4. Take your groupings (6 cookies each) and package them up for swapping. Keep it simple or get creative—your choice. At least include a label for the cookies.


5. In addition to the package labels, please print out a list of the ingredients to display at our event. You don't have to print the recipe . . . just the ingredients is enough.


6. Oh, and save a couple cookies to put out on a plate for sampling.


7. Be ready to bring home a fun variety of cookies, and maybe get a little inspiration for some new recipes!

• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • •


If you think about it, this type of event is really efficient. Seriously!


No need to make several different types of cookies for a holiday party. It's time consuming and messy, with boatloads of dishwashing.


Instead, you can take the variety of cookies from our Food Swap, group them on a platter, and look like the rock star that you are.

• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • •

Please feel free to invite your friends! Even if they are not members of the cookbook club, they are more than welcome to participate in our Food Swap events. Have them follow the directions listed above, and add them to your RSVP (so we have a head count).

The venue offers a cash bar if you'd like to enjoy a refreshing beverage during the event. I'll bring some savory snacks for us to enjoy. Venue located near the Beverly MBTA station. On street parking available, in addition to a new parking garage across the street.


Other than that . . . let's bake some cookies and get a sweet start to our Food Swap event series (January will be a soup swap).


Feel free to comment with any ideas, questions, or some fun stories!


I hope you can join us.

Warmly,

Jessica
results.name: Food Swap — Holiday Cookies

results.description:
</a>

Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

<a href="https://2015bostonatwysspeeddating.eventbrite.com">https://2015bostonatwysspeeddating.eventbrite.com


(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/atwysspeeddating/"></a>
results.name: Speeddating Ages 35-47 - SOLD OUT FOR WOMEN

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:

results.description:
This is an ongoing weekly (donation only) class for anyone, offering experiential practice in meditation, along with an opportunity to be among others interested in deepening spiritutual practices.  The class provides you with a felt sense of your own divinity; your Higher Self. The meditation, based on Kriya practices,  is partly guided, partly silent. In the guided part we open up to the flow of golden light and energy that is always pouring down to our body/mind/heart and being. Accessing that flow and inviting it to fill us brings a profound level of openness, while washing away limiting thoughts, feelings and beliefs. This higher vibration of unconditional love serves to open our consciousness to new levels of peace, joy and awakening. Bringing the flow of light into the body/mind/heart means we more consciously embody our Light Being, so we are more present, happy, forgiving, peaceful and joyful while in the world.
   After the guided portion we spend time in peaceful silence.  Whether you are an experienced meditator or a beginner, you will love the sweetness and powerful energies of this group. At the end of the class we make time for questions or sharing.  Group meditation is powerful, and it's refreshing to be among fellow travelers!
   Judy also teaches the Sound and Light meditation; a way for you to draw your senses inward to open your spiritual eye and to hear the sounds of your chakras. 
   This practice is non-denominational, appropriate for anyone. 
   Held in a lovely healing space, just walking in will bring you instant peace.  All are welcome.
    You may also want to check out my other Meetup, for a variety of spiritual programs:  http://www.meetup.com/Evolving-Beings/
results.how_to_find_us: Enter at The Hawthorne Building, the large glass doors to the left of H&R Block.
results.name: The Salem MA Weekly Meditation Group

group.name: The Salem MA Meditation Meetup Group

results.description:
Sunday, December 13, 2015, AMC Cinema, 22 Flutie Pass, Framingham, MA - 6:00 p.m. show - TICKETS NOW AVAILABLE FOR PURCHASE ONLINE


This is a Movie Meetup to see “Spotlight,” at the AMC Cinema in Framingham. The movie begins at 6:00 p.m. so we’ll start gathering at 5:30 p.m. and go into the theatre at 5:45 p.m.

The AMC is newly remodeled with cushy reclining seats. Tickets can be purchased online ahead of time and it’s not unusual for shows to sell out. So, attendees will need to do the following:

Go to:

https://www.amctheatres.com/movie-theatres/boston/amc-framingham-16-with-dine-in-theatres


1. At the top of the list of movies and showtimes is a pull-down calendar. SET THE DATE TO THE CORRECT DATE or you’ll end up with tickets for a different date!

2. Scroll down to the movie and click on the correct time.

3. Enter the quantity of tickets you want and click the button for “Add To Cart.”

4. Scroll to the top of the page and click on the icon for your cart.

5. Click the “Checkout” button.

6. If you’re a Stubs member, you’ll be able to log in, or click “Continue as Guest.” (Stubs membership is $9 per year. Stubs members aren’t charged the $1.25 convenience fee.)

7. On the right side of the page, click the button for “Select Seats.” The movie theatre is now all assigned seating. The seats in white are available.

8. I bought seat F8. So try to get seats in row F and once those are gone, try row E, and so on. It’s likely that some of us won’t be sitting together. Click on a seat and then click the button for “Continue.”

9. You’ll be able to enter your payment information and then Complete Purchase.

10. On the next screen you can do any or all of these things: Print a copy of your ticket to bring with you, view the virtual ticket on your screen, or send a confirmation to your mobile phone via text (you can show them that when you get there). I’m going to print my ticket just in case, and I sent a text to my phone as well.


On the evening of the movie we will start gathering at the AMC at 5:30 p.m. and go into the theatre at 5:45. Meet up at the far right side of the lobby. I’ll be wearing a small “Meetup” badge.

After the movie, we'll gather right outside the theatre's entrance doors (where you go in to be seated, not the outside doors) to decide where we'll go for refreshments. Catch up with us there if you've arrived late or haven't found us.

Please remember to update your RSVP if your plans change.

P.S. Please read the subject matter of the movie (below) and consider whether it’s suitable for you. Some may find it objectionable. I hear the movie doesn’t go into details about the crimes themselves; it’s about the investigation.


Spotlight
Starring Michael Keaton, Mark Ruffalo, Rachel McAdams, Liev Schreiber, Brian d’Arcy James, and Stanley Tucci, SPOTLIGHT tells the riveting true story of the Pulitzer Prize-winning Boston Globe investigation that would rock the city and cause a crisis in one of the world’s oldest and most trusted institutions. When the newspaper’s tenacious “Spotlight” team of reporters delves into allegations of abuse in the Catholic Church, their year-long investigation uncovers a decades-long cover-up at the highest levels of Boston's religious, legal, and government establishment, touching off a wave of revelations around the world. Directed by Academy Award-nominee Tom McCarthy, SPOTLIGHT is a tense investigative dramatic-thriller, tracing the steps to one of the biggest cover-ups in modern times.


Rated: R
Running Time: 2 hr 8 min
Genre: Drama
Director: Tom McCarthy
Cast: Michael Keaton, Mark Ruffalo, Rachel McAdams, Liev Schreiber, Brian d’Arcy James, and Stanley Tucci
Release Date: November 6, 2015
results.how_to_find_us: Meet to the far right side of the lobby.
results.name: Movie Meetup: "Spotlight," Sun., Dec. 13, AMC Cinema in Framingham (Redux)

results.description:
As another year comes to an end, let's get together and celebrate it with an AID-MIT and Boston open mic!
We invite you to participate by perfoming (but not limited to) music, dance, poetry, comedy, and even storytelling.


Original performances are welcome, but we warmly welcome whatever you have to offer...or simply come hang out and mingle! If you're interested in performing or signup here: http://bit.ly/AIDOpenMic2015signup


$10 suggested donation at the door. There will be light appetizers and snacks.

Where : http://whereis.mit.edu/?go=W20

Vox Populi - An Open Mic event.
results.name: Vox Populi - An Open Mic Event : Dec 13 6-8 PM

results.description:
Please join us for dinner and a discussion on effective altruism! We'll be focusing on the recommendations that have recently come out from charity evaluators like GiveWell, Animal Charity Evaluators, Giving What We Can, and The Life You Can Save. How do these places come up with their recommended charities? How can you tell how much an evaluator's values line up with yours? Do you give to one or several charities? And how do you decide whether or how much to give?

Sunday, December 13
6 pm - but feel free to drop in later
(Ask us for the address)

The house is a 10-minute walk from Porter or Davis on the red line.   Street parking is unrestricted on Sundays.

Vegetarian/vegan-friendly dinner will be served; let me know if you have food needs beyond that. Feel free to bring friends! Just RSVP so I know how much food we need.
results.name: Dinner/discussion on charity recommendations

results.description:
Save the date for the 1st annual Sew Good Meetup holiday party! I've added a poll under the "more" section for members to vote on a restaurant. Please vote by October 1st and then I will make the reservation.

Let's plan on having a Yankee swap, is a $15 limit reasonable? Please comment with thoughts or ideas for the party :)

Update 10/16/15: The poll is now closed and our Holiday gathering will be at Cobblestones in Lowell! They have a small parking lot and nearby street parking which is free on Sundays. I will call them to try and reserve a table and if they won't let me make a reservation I will arrive early to get a table :) Let's plan on a $15 sewing themed Yankee swap gift.

Cobblestones have a really vast menu and items ranging from $7.99 for an entree sized salad to $36 for a filet. They accommodate allergies really well too so I think there will be something for everyone :)
results.name: Holiday Party

results.description:
Join us on Sunday, December 13th 6:00-9:00 p.m. for a holiday-themed potluck and social gathering. The evening will primarily be an opportunity for old and new friends to get better acquainted with some time set aside for collective reflection and discussion. 


Some questions we'll consider...

The United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization has declared 2015 the International Year of Soils. This year has brought dramatic changes in thinking about the relevance of soils, along with several paradigm-shifting conferences organized by Biodiversity for a Livable Climate that have drawn increasing awareness to the exciting possibilities of ecological restoration. What have we learned this year, how did all this change happen, and how should we proceed in 2016 and beyond? Will biodiversity-based solutions emerge in the discussions at the upcoming COP 21 climate talks in Paris happening November 30th-December 11th?  What can we do to ensure that ecosystems restoration gains widespread recognition as an important tool in the fight against climate change?

Directions to Helen's house: 

Helen's house is about halfway between Central Square and Inman Square. If you take the MBTA red line to Central Square, exit the station walking down Massachusetts Avenue in the direction of Harvard Square (away from Boston). Walk six blocks and make a right on Lee Street, then walk two blocks past Harvard Street and Broadway. Cross Broadway onto Fayette Street (which will be in front of you) and then make your first left onto Fayette Park (a private way). Helen's house is toward the end, on the right.
results.name: Reviewing 2015, the International Year of Soils: Holiday Potluck

Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

<a href="https://2015bostonatwysspeeddating.eventbrite.com">https://2015bostonatwysspeeddating.eventbrite.com


(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
From 6:30 to 7:30 PM, every Sunday evening, the BK Learning Center for Peace is open to everyone wanting to deepen their meditation experiences, filling the self with peace and power to develop spiritual capacity for the challenging week ahead.

Guidance and simple visual exercises that enable us to access our inner peace and strength will be offered during the meditation session.

 

All are welcome to attend and no RSVP is needed.

 

This is offered FREE OF CHARGE as a community service
results.name: Sunday Night Meditation

results.description:
Hypnosis is a most effective, safe and natural way for personal change.There are probably more myths, misconceptions, and misinformation about hypnosis than any other subject. Hypnosis is neither Black Magic or Supernatural. Hypnotist or Hypnotherapist are not Psychics or Palm readers with "Special Powers". Hypnosis has been found to be a natural state of being and Hypnotherapy based on many years of clinical research by famous psychologist such a Dr. Sigmund Freud, Dr. Carl Jung and others. Would you like to learn how to end a cycle of unwanted behavior, Do you have a feeling inside that you don't like? Do you want to change something about yourself? Hypnosis can help and empowers us to: solve our own problems, gain strength, confidence, focus & control, activate our inner healing powers and more. In the end of the class you will experience group hypnosis and make a first step to find more contentment within.

In her talk Olga Privina, a Consulting Hypnotist, will share how unconscious mind can be used as a tool to achieve change.   

Price: FREE
results.how_to_find_us: Above McGill's convenience store. Parking on the street
results.name: Self-Hypnosis for Personal Transformation

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating  Ages 22-32 - SOLD OUT FOR MEN
